title: Remote Sales & Customer Support Coordinator (Technical Products)
description:
HOURS: Monday - Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Sydney Time (AEDT).



ABOUT THE ROLE: KF Plastics is a leading plastic fabrication company in Sydney. We are looking for the "Voice" of our company. You will manage our digital front desk, handling an even split of inbound calls and
 enquiries. We do NOT want a silent data entry clerk. We need a confident, fast learner who can quote standard products instantly and act as a "Technical Gatekeeper" for complex engineering jobs.



YOUR MISSION:



1. Phone & Technical Support (50% of your day):



Answer Inbound Calls: You are the first person customers speak to. You must sound professional, friendly, and Australian-business-ready.



Technical Triage: You will handle questions about material availability and standard cuts. For complex engineering questions, you act as the gatekeeper—gathering the specs and passing them to our Engineering Team.



Close the Sale: Use our internal "Calculator" to quote Cut-to-Size jobs instantly and take payment over the phone.



2.
 & Operations (50% of your day):



Inbox Zero: Reply to
s within minutes, not hours.



Quoting: Process standard quote requests from our website using our pricing tools.



Follow-Up: Call customers 48 hours after a quote is sent to check if they are ready to proceed.



Logistics: Book couriers (Shippit) and ensure customers get their tracking numbers.



REQUIREMENTS:



Excellent Spoken English: You must have a clear, neutral accent and be confident speaking on the phone with Australian tradespeople and engineers.



Technical Aptitude: You don't need to be an engineer, but you must be able to learn the difference between "Acrylic" and "Polycarbonate" quickly. If you have sold technical or industrial products before, tell us!



"Closer" Mindset: You are comfortable asking: "Would you like to pay for that now so we can start production?"



Tech Savvy: Fast learner on HubSpot, Xero, Google Sheets, and VoIP tools.



HOW TO APPLY: To prove you have the attention to detail we need, please do the following:



Record a 60-second voice message (use 
) introducing yourself. Tell us about a time you had to learn a technical product or explain something complex to a customer.



Send your Resume and the Link to your voice recording.



Important: In your
, please confirm your "Preferred English Name" that you would use on the phone with clients.



Set your
 subject line to: "I am your new Front Counter Coordinator - [Your Name]"

title: Full Stack Sales Rep/Closer
description:
Clinicly Inc. is a distributor of innovative wellness technology in North America. Our flagship product, the NovaPod 2.0, is a futuristic wellness capsule combining six therapies in one device. It helps medspas, gyms, and wellness centers generate new recurring revenue while giving clients life-changing results.



We’re looking for a motivated Account Executive based in the Philippines to join our remote sales team. You’ll manage warm inbound leads from first contact through to closed sale.





What You’ll Do



- Call inbound leads quickly after they inquire (no cold calling)

- Handle SMS & send info
s

- Answer questions, build rapport, and explain NovaPod’s benefits (scripts provided)

- Send brochures, demo videos, and financing details to prospects

- Follow up by phone, SMS, and
 until the buyer is ready

- Guide the client to complete their purchase (send invoice/payment link)

- Hit monthly sales targets (4–8+ sales/month)

- Track all activity in CRM and maintain timely follow-ups





What We Offer



- Pay Structure: $1,500 USD/month + $325 commission per sale (full-time, remote)

- ?Expected On Target Earnings - $4,100/month

- Bonuses: Monthly performance bonuses for hitting sales targets

- Warm Leads Only: All leads come from our ad campaigns — no cold prospecting

- Training & Scripts Provided: You’ll be fully equipped to succeed

- Stable Long-Term Role: We want someone to grow with us

- Work From Home: Flexible remote work with set U.S./Canada hours





What We’re Looking For



- Excellent spoken and written English (neutral accent preferred)

- Very good at natural communication in English

- Driven and motivated to meet sales targets

- Highly organized with consistent follow-up discipline

- 2+ years sales experience (call center, inbound/outbound, or account management)





Why Join Us?



This role gives you the chance to represent a premium, in-demand product with strong support behind you. You’ll receive warm leads, base pay, bonuses, and long-term stability, with the opportunity to grow into senior roles as we expand.

title: Senior Video Editor for Fast-Growing Skincare E-Commerce Brand (Multi 6-Figure DTC)
description:

base + performance bonuses for winning ad creatives

Performance Bonuses: Earn additional bonuses when your video edits become winning ad creatives that drive significant revenue. We reward editors whose work directly contributes to our growth. Top-performing creatives can earn you $50-$200+ in bonuses per winning ad. This means your actual earnings can be significantly higher than base rate when you consistently create high-converting content.



About Us

We are a rapidly scaling skincare e-commerce brand targeting women 45-65+. We're running paid ads on Meta, Youtube, and other platforms and need a skilled video editor to create high-converting ad content that drives conversions.

title: Video Editor for Online Medical Education Course — Ongoing Work
description:
WHO WE ARE:

Prepping Partner is a growing online education business founded by an emergency medicine physician. We teach medical professionals and families how to prepare for emergencies through courses, webinars, and social media content. Our audience is doctors, veterinarians, dentists, and other professionals — so our content needs to be polished, credible, and calm (not flashy or hype-driven).

WHAT WE NEED RIGHT NOW:

A skilled video editor to polish recorded lecture-style presentations. These are slide-based talks with the instructor speaking on camera. They've been partially edited in Descript (filler words and dead air removed). Your job is to take them the rest of the way:



Make the slides look sharper and more visually engaging

Improve pacing, transitions, and flow

Clean up audio (levels, clarity, any remaining issues)

Remove any off-topic tangents or side conversations to create evergreen content

Add simple intro/outro (templates will be provided)

Export in correct formats for YouTube and course hosting



THE IMMEDIATE PROJECT:



4 lecture videos (~2 hours each after initial edit) ready NOW

12 more lectures coming over the next 3-4 months

1 hour of taste-test footage to cut into short promotional clips and b-roll

Potential course intro video



ONGOING WORK (after initial project):



Monthly webinar recordings to edit

Short-form clips for
, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

Promotional videos and b-roll creation

Potential for growing into additional VA tasks (affiliate link management, uploading, etc.)



THIS ROLE IS A GREAT FIT IF YOU:



Have experience editing talking-head or educational content (not just music videos or gaming)

Know how to make a speaker and slides look professional WITHOUT overdoing effects

Can work independently once you understand the style

Communicate clearly and respond within 24 hours

Can handle feedback and revisions without taking it personally

Want a long-term relationship with one client, not a one-off gig



REQUIRED SKILLS:



Video editing: Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or similar professional tool

Descript experience (strongly preferred — we use it for initial editing)

Audio cleanup: noise reduction, level balancing, voice enhancement

Basic motion graphics: lower thirds, text overlays, clean transitions

Short-form content creation (Reels, Shorts, TikTok-style clips)

Strong English communication (written and spoken — we'll do a Zoom call)



NICE TO HAVE:



Adobe Audition or dedicated audio editing experience

Experience editing for medical, educational, or professional audiences

Canva skills for thumbnails

YouTube uploading and optimization experience

Experience with course platforms (Kajabi, Teachable, etc.)



SCHEDULE & PAY:



Part-time to start: approximately 10-15 hours/week (will vary by project load)

Pay: $4-6/hour USD depending on experience (negotiable for the right person)

Paid weekly via Wise or PayPal

Flexible hours — but must overlap with US Eastern Time for at least 2-3 hours for communication

Long-term position for the right person



HOW TO APPLY:

Please include ALL of the following (incomplete applications will not be reviewed):



A brief introduction — who you are and why you're a good fit

Your video editing experience — how many years, what types of content, what software

A link to your portfolio showing at least 2 examples of LONG-FORM talking-head or educational video editing (this is essential — if your portfolio only shows music videos or gaming content, this isn't the right fit)

Your hourly rate expectation

Your availability — hours per week and timezone

A short description of your editing process — how do you approach a raw lecture recording from start to finish?



HIRING PROCESS:



Review applications

Short Zoom call with top candidates (15 minutes)

Paid test project using our actual content ($50-75)

Hire and begin ongoing work



We're looking to hire within the next 1-2 weeks. Serious applicants only.



I'm really looking for someone who can take my project and suggest great ways to elevate it. My audience is professionals, doctors, vets, and lawyers. They want it to be classy, amazing, but fun. I love artistry.

title: Experienced Pre-Press/Printing Graphic Design Person
description:
Howdy y'all!  We are New York based marketing agency that is looking for assistance with graphic design specifically pertaining to pre-press and printing.  If you believe you qualify, you must review all the requirements below.  If you do not have specific experience in pre-press and printing, it is not likely you should apply for this position, so please read the post completely and thoroughly, and, respond accordingly.



We currently work with Adobe InDesign but are willing consider a move to Canva Pro.  We currently use Adobe Creative Suite, but you would need to provide your own Canva Pro account.  We like Canva Pro but haven't yet fully committed to it.  Therefore, our work is initially in Adobe InDesign (which is the standard still for American pre-press work).



Here are the requirements to apply; when you respond to this post, just please make it very clear that you can meet each requirement:



*  Robust experience using either Adobe Creative Suite or Canva Pro.  (Note: having only an unlicensed version of Canva would be insufficient for this position).



*  Depth of commercially produced and commercially viable pre-press and printed work; such designs would be for printed postcards, or brochures, or magazines, or envelopes, or letterhead, or annual reports, or similar.  In other words, you must be able to demonstrate that you have significant pre-press experience.



*  Online portfolio (such as 
) that would be easy for us to review your past efforts. Unfortunately, we will not comb through anyone's online digital image repositories to glean design talents and abilities (e.g. we will not be going through images on GoogleDrive, Dropbox, etc.).



*  Abidance of pre-press "best practices" in graphic design.  Examples of standard pre-press best practices are:  use of layers (images/text) in InDesign, version control, packaged subfolders (InDesign), proper use of white space (and reverse white space), knowledge of design effects, controlled use of fonts that are either common or packaged with your design, and perhaps most of all, crops-for-bleeds (crop marks). [Note: if you are not familiar with these terms, it is not likely that this position is for you.]



*  Availability such that your hours coi
 with our hours here in New York (New York time = GMT-5 or Eastern Standard Time [EST]).  It is not necessary that you work an overnight, but you will need to have overlap at least our time zone for a minimum of 3 hours.  Further, you must be available to respond within 12 hours if we need assistance.  While it is, of course, unreasonable that your availability would be "on demand", we nonetheless must establish some sort of minimum and agreed upon response time protocols.



*  Consciousness that the design work for our clients is time sensitive and budget sensitive.  Example: on the U.S. Eastern Seaboard, one side of a 5 1/2" x 8 1/2" postcard would take no more than one (1) hour; working on a two-sided card would therefore take no more than one and a half (1.5) to two (2) hours.  The turn-around would need to be within 24 hours.  We would pay by the hour.  



Good news:  we can train for U.S. Postal Service regulations regarding physical mailpiece standards and layout out.  Further, we also know that you cannot read minds so our job ticket descriptions are usually very detailed.  However, we are unable to train for carefulness of effort and awareness of reading job tickets properly.  Once completed, your files would be re-uploaded to our cloud server or otherwise accessible to us online to our digital network.  Finally, your use of the English language would need to be solid and there is an expectation that your attitude would be positive and of good cheer.



When you apply, please (a) respond here and (b) also send an
 to 
 wherein your will state "Hey HR Manager, I really read the WHOLE post!".  In this way, we'll know that - yes, you guessed it - actually read the whole post.  Questions?  First, respond positive to the requirements above, and then we are happy to answer any questions!



Thank you!

title: SEO Publisher & On-Page SEO Specialist (Part-Time VA)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are a photography-based service business with consistent daily content production.

We already have writers creating blog posts.



We are looking for a detail-oriented SEO VA whose responsibility is to take finished blog posts and turn them into clean, search-optimized pages that get indexed, earn impressions, and drive long-term traffic.



This role is focused on execution, structure, and consistency - not blog writing and not SEO theory.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



You will take completed content and turn it into properly optimized SEO assets.



Publish blog posts to WordPress



Optimize on-page SEO:



SEO titles and meta descriptions



Correct H1, H2, H3 structure



Add relevant internal links to service and pillar pages



Optimize images (compression, correct sizing, WebP when possible)



Write clean, accurate alt text (no keyword stuffing)



Ensure formatting is clean and readable



Create related Google Business Profile posts when appropriate



Monitor Google Search Console (indexing, impressions, clicks, CTR)



Improve underperforming posts when needed



Deliver a simple weekly SEO report (numbers + brief notes)



HOW WE MEASURE SUCCESS (IMPORTANT)



We do not measure SEO by “rankings.”



We measure success by:



Proper indexing in Google Search Console



Growth in impressions over time



Clicks and CTR trends



Clean on-page structure and internal linking



Clear explanations of SEO decisions



If you cannot explain why you made an SEO change, this role is not a fit.



REQUIRED SKILLS



WordPress CMS experience



Strong understanding of on-page SEO



Experience with Yoast, RankMath, or SEOPress



Google Search Console familiarity



Image optimization knowledge



Internal linking best practices



High attention to detail



Clear written English



Ability to explain decisions in simple language



NICE TO HAVE (NOT REQUIRED)



Local SEO experience



Google Business Profile management



GA4 familiarity



Basic schema knowledge



Clean citation or directory submission experience



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



This role is NOT:



? A blog writing position



? A backlink-spamming role



? An “SEO guru” or strategy consultant



? Black-hat SEO, PBNs, or comment spam



We want clean, long-term, sustainable SEO execution.



REQUIRED TO APPLY (SCREENING FILTER)



To apply, please answer ALL of the following:



How do you d
 which keyword to target for a blog post?



What do you check in Google Search Console after publishing?



What do you do with blog posts that are not performing?



Applications without clear answers will not be reviewed.



PAID TEST TASK (FINALISTS ONLY)



Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid test task:



Optimize one existing blog post



Provide SEO title, meta description, headers, internal links



Briefly explain your decisions



We are evaluating clarity, cleanliness, and reasoning — not speed.



HOURS & PAY



8–10 hours per week to start



Flexible schedule



Pay range: $3–5 USD per hour, depending on experience



Pay is based on role responsibility and execution quality, not generic AI estimates.



WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS



Content that isn’t optimized doesn’t perform.



Your job is to turn published content into search-visible, traffic-generating assets through consistent, careful execution.



If you enjoy structured work, clean systems, and improving performance over time, this role will be a good fit.



FINAL NOTE



We value clarity, consistency, and long-term thinking over buzzwords.



If you can explain what you’re doing and why, you’ll do well here.

title: Full-Cycle Sales Rep / Account Executive
description:
About Us



Clinicly Inc. is a distributor of innovative wellness technology in North America. Our flagship product, the NovaPod 2.0, is a futuristic wellness capsule combining six therapies in one device. It helps medspas, gyms, and wellness centers generate new recurring revenue while giving clients life-changing results.



We’re looking for a motivated Account Executive based in the Philippines to join our remote sales team. You’ll manage warm inbound leads from first contact through to closed sale.





What You’ll Do



- Call inbound leads quickly after they inquire (no cold calling)

- Handle SMS & send info
s

- Answer questions, build rapport, and explain NovaPod’s benefits (scripts provided)

- Send brochures, demo videos, and financing details to prospects

- Follow up by phone, SMS, and
 until the buyer is ready

- Guide the client to complete their purchase (send invoice/payment link)

- Hit monthly sales targets (4–8+ sales/month)

-  Track all activity in CRM and maintain timely follow-ups





What We Offer



- Base Pay: $1,800 USD/month (full-time, remote)

- Bonuses: Monthly performance bonuses for hitting sales targets

- Warm Leads Only: All leads come from our ad campaigns — no cold prospecting

- Training & Scripts Provided: You’ll be fully equipped to succeed

- Stable Long-Term Role: We want someone to grow with us

- Work From Home: Flexible remote work with set U.S./Canada hours





What We’re Looking For



- Excellent spoken and written English (neutral accent preferred)

- Very good at natural communication in English

- Driven and motivated to meet sales targets

- Highly organized with consistent follow-up discipline

- 2+ years sales experience (call center, inbound/outbound, or account management) 





Why Join Us?



This role gives you the chance to represent a premium, in-demand product with strong support behind you. You’ll receive warm leads, base pay, bonuses, and long-term stability, with the opportunity to grow into senior roles as we expand.

title: Ad Buyer / VA (Meta Ads Specialist)
description:
**About the Role**

This isn’t one of those job posts that promises you’ll be “changing lives” by managing ads for a random dropshipping store. I run a growing marketing agency that works with real local service businesses. We actually care if the ads work, because clients stick around when they do. I need someone sharp to make sure campaigns don’t just run, but perform. Think of it like babysitting… except the baby is a
 Ads Manager account that sometimes throws tantrums.



**What You’ll Get**



* A boss who won’t micromanage your every click (I hate that too).

* Straightforward systems that already bring results—you’ll just be turning the knobs and testing smartly.

* The chance to work with businesses where your results are actually felt. You’ll see the impact, not just a spreadsheet.

* A seat at the table as we grow—your ideas won’t get buried under “corporate.”



**Requirements**



* You’ve run Meta Ads before and have proof (case studies, screenshots, actual data—
s don’t count).

* You know what a good CPL looks like and how to get there.

* You can work 8am–1pm MST, no ghosting.

* Clear communicator. If you spot something broken, you say it. If you have an idea, you bring it.

* Detail-oriented, but not to the point where you alphabetize your sock drawer.



**What I’m Looking For**

I’m a leader, and I want to build with leaders. I don’t need a button-pusher. I need someone who owns their work, solves problems, and can laugh when Meta d
 to randomly reject an ad for “violating community standards” because it showed a picture of a lawn.



**Compensation**



* Competitive and based on your results. Show me you can bring the leads in, and we’ll take care of you.

* Long-term role with room to grow as the agency grows.



**How to Apply**

Send me:



1. Your experience running Meta Ads.

2. Proof of past results (screenshots, CPLs, etc.).

3. Confirmation you’re good with 8am–1pm MST.



If you want a job where your work directly drives client growth and you don’t have to deal with corporate nonsense, this is it.

title: Instagram & Social Media Manager-Strategy & Growth for Service Businesses
description:
We are looking for an experienced Social Media Manager with strong Instagram experience to help manage and grow social media presence for several local service businesses.



This role is focused on building visibility, trust, and generating real business inquiries — not just posting graphics.



You will initially work with:



CPA / Tax & Advisory Services



Residential Cleaning Business



Landscaping Business



These are local service businesses where customers choose providers based on trust, professionalism, and consistency. The goal is to create content that positions each business as a reliable local expert.



What We Are Trying to Achieve



Our approach is similar to how professional marketing agencies manage campaigns:



01 — Social Media Strategy & Optimization



Establish consistent messaging and content themes that educate customers and build trust. Improve engagement quality and encourage inquiries from local customers.



02 — Content & Profile Optimization



Improve profiles, captions, and content structure so potential customers clearly understand services and can easily take action (call, message, or request a quote).



03 — Engagement & Growth Systems



Develop repeatable processes for content planning, posting schedules, and engagement that steadily improve reach and visibility over time.



Follower count alone is not the goal. Quality engagement and inquiries are the priority.

title: Technical Operations Manager (Virtual)
description:
Role Overview



We are seeking a high-agency Technical Operations Manager to serve as the "right hand" to leadership. This is not a traditional administrative role; it is a hybrid position requiring a blend of executive support, sales development, multimedia production, and software automation.



The AI Philosophy: We expect you to be an "AI-First" professional. You should be proficient in leveraging LLMs and automation tools to 10x your output. However, AI is your assistant, not your replacement. You must possess the fundamental skills to audit, edit, and improve everything the AI produces to ensure 100% quality and brand alignment.

Key Responsibilities

1. Executive & Operations Support



    Gatekeeping: Manage complex calendars and high-volume
 inboxes with discretion and precision.

    Vendor & Talent Management: Oversee external vendors and qualify applicants for open roles using our established internal processes.

    Process Documentation: Build and maintain "Standard Operating Procedures" (SOPs) to ensure the business scales efficiently.



2. Sales, CRM & Lead Management



    Lead Pipeline: Add, qualify, and segment leads within the CRM.

    Active Outreach: Initiate contact and execute rigorous follow-up sequences to move leads through the funnel.

    Data Integrity: Ensure all communications are logged and the CRM remains the "single source of truth."



3. Multimedia & Content Production



    Podcast Management: Edit raw audio/video recordings into polished episodes (including intro/outros, noise reduction, and flow).

    Publishing: Manage the end-to-end distribution process across hosting platforms and social media.

    Social Content: Slicing long-form content into high-engagement clips for various social channels.



4. Automation & Technical Projects



    No-Code/Low-Code Dev: Build and maintain automations (Zapier, Make, or similar) to connect our tech stack.

    Coding: Assist with software-based coding projects (Python, JavaScript, or similar) to solve specific business problems.

    AI Implementation: Identify opportunities to integrate AI into existing workflows to increase efficiency.



Qualifications & Skills



    The Fundamentals: Exceptional written and verbal communication. You must be able to write a professional
 and a technical brief without relying on "Generic AI-speak."

    Technical Stack: Proficiency in CRM software (HubSpot, Salesforce, or Pipedrive), Podcast Editing software (Descript, Adobe Audition, or similar), and project management tools (ClickUp, Notion, or Asana).

    Coding Literacy: Ability to read, write, and debug code for business automation and software projects.

    AI Mastery: Expert-level prompting skills and experience with AI-assisted coding and content generation.

    The "Vibe": You are a self-starter who solves problems before they reach the CEO's desk.



The Hiring Process (Our "Standard of Excellence")



We value your time and ours. Our vetting process is rigorous:



    Initial Screen: Review of portfolio and technical experience.

    The "Quality Test": A paid work sample involving a complex automation task and a communication scenario where you must audit an AI-generated response for quality.

    Video Interview: A deep dive into your logic, technical stack, and cultural fit.



Why This Role?



You will have the autonomy to build systems from the ground up and work at the bleeding edge of AI and business operations. You won't just be "checking boxes"—you will be driving the engine.



Application Process



To be considered for this position, please visit: 



This position requires candidates to successfully complete our comprehensive evaluation process, which includes technical assessments and multiple interview stages to ensure the best fit for both the role and our organizational culture.

title: GoHighLevel Campaign & Funnel Builder (Part-Time, 20hrs/wk, Long-Term)
description:
WHY THIS ROLE IS DIFFERENT



Most GHL job posts are one-off projects. This isn't that.



I'm hiring one person to become my go-to GoHighLevel builder for the long haul. Consistent hours. Consistent pay. Room to grow your skills and your income over time. I don't want to hire and re-hire. I want to find the right person once and build together for years.



You'll be working directly with a US-based digital marketing company (California) that runs multiple campaigns, funnels, and automations inside GoHighLevel every month. There is no shortage of work.



IMMEDIATE PROJECT



12 funnels need to be rebuilt from Kartra into GoHighLevel. This is your Day 1 assignment. From there, you'll continue building new campaigns on an ongoing basis.



COMPENSATION



Rate: $10/hr USD (approximately ?586/hr PHP)

Hours: 20 hours per week

Monthly: $800 USD (approximately ?46,800 PHP)

Schedule: Flexible hours. Must have some overlap with US Pacific Time (California) for check-ins and communication.

Payment: Reliable. On time. Every time.

Growth: Hours and rate increase as you prove yourself.





WHAT YOU'LL BUILD



Lead magnet opt-in funnels. Webinar registration and replay funnels. Low-ticket offer funnels. Appointment booking funnels.
 nurture sequences. Complete end-to-end campaigns with proper tagging, tracking, and integrations tied together correctly.



You'll also work with landing pages, registration pages, sales pages, webinar pages, thank you pages, membership site pages, affiliate pages, and general website pages.



REQUIRED GHL EXPERIENCE (all four, non-negotiable)

You must have recent, hands-on GoHighLevel experience with every one of these:



Workflows, Automations & Tags. Multi-step sequences, conditional logic, proper tagging architecture.

Landing Pages, Forms &
s. Building and customizing pages, embedding forms, designing
 templates inside GHL.

Integrations & Tracking. Pixel placement, API integrations, affiliate tracking, UTM parameters, tracking codes, basic SEO.

Snapshots. Building, exporting, and deploying complete campaign snapshots.



If you're missing experience in any one of these four areas, this role is not the right fit.



WHO SUCCEEDS IN THIS ROLE



You think like a campaign architect, not just a page builder. You understand how tags, triggers, tracking, and integrations connect into one system.

You hit every deadline. No excuses, no surprises.

You track your hours honestly and give progress updates without being asked.

You ask questions the 
nt something is unclear instead of guessing and hoping.

You take pride in clean, professional-looking work. (I'm hiring a builder, not a designer, but your pages should look sharp.)

You want stability and growth, not just another gig.





WHAT YOU GET



20 hours per week, every week

Long-term role (years, not months)

Opportunity to increase hours and rate as we grow together

Clear communication, organized projects, structured feedback

A team that invests in your development





HOW TO APPLY (3 requirements, all mandatory)



I read every application personally. To be considered, you must do all three of the following:

1. Subject line: "I AM The Experienced GHL Expert You Seek!"

if you are NOT a true GHL expert... please do not apply. 

2. Show your GHL work. Include links or screenshots of funnels and campaigns you have recently built inside GoHighLevel. I do not need to see work from ClickFunnels, Kartra, ActiveCampaign, Kajabi, LeadPages, or any other platform. GoHighLevel examples only. 

No GHL portfolio, no interview.

3. Answer this question in your application: "What is the most profitable GHL campaign you've built, and what made it profitable?"

If your application is missing any of these three items, it will not be reviewed. Zero exceptions.



I'm looking forward to finding the right person for this role.

Travis, California

title: Virtual Assistant - Appointment Setter
description:
Our mission is to help busy Asian men lose stubborn belly fat and get lean without giving up cultural foods. We’ve built a thriving community and now need a world-class communicator to handle inbound/outbound DMs, qualify leads, and book as many sales calls as possible.





Pay:

- 40–50 hours per week

- Base Salary: $650 USD/month

- Commission: 3% revenue from every client you book that closes

- Total Earning Potential: $1,000–$1,500+ per month (top performers earn more)





About the Role:

- Starting conversations in the DMs with new followers, engagers, and leads (using proven scripts + frameworks we provide).

- Qualifying leads by asking natural, smart questions.

- Booking qualified prospects directly into sales calls with our closer/coach.

- Following up with warm leads daily until they book.

- Updating our CRM + tracking conversations for full accountability.

- Matching our tone/voice so every conversation feels personal and authentic.

- This is a performance-driven role. The more qualified calls you book, the more you earn.



REQUIREMENTS:



- Fluent English Skills: Excellent written + verbal communication. Must be able to type and respond FAST in perfect English.

- Prior Experience: 1–3+ years as an Instagram/FB DM appointment setter (fitness coaching industry preferred).

- Proven Track Record: Demonstrated success booking qualified calls that actually show.

- Modern Equipment: Reliable laptop + stable, high-speed internet.

- Social Media Savvy: Familiar with Instagram and
 
 platforms.

- Adaptability: Able to quickly pick up and follow a specific communication style.

- Discipline: Comfortable sending 80–100+ high-quality DMs per day.

- Flexibility: Willing to work mornings, evenings, and weekends if needed.

- Positive, coachable, and hungry to grow with a fast-moving team.





Why Join Us:



- Work directly with a fast-growing multi 6-figure fitness coaching business serving the Asian community.

- Be part of a fast-growing business that’s on track to become the #1 fitness coaching brand serving the Asian community.

- Clear systems, scripts, and training to set you up for success.

- Performance-based culture: high performers earn raises, bonuses, and leadership opportunities.

- Remote work + flexible schedule.

- Paid training and long-term growth potential





HOW TO APPLY:

- Reply directly to this job post with a brief message expressing your interest to apply.

- Book in for an interview using the following link: 

- Reply "BOOKED" to confirm that you booked in for your interview





Looking forward to speaking with you!

You understand that in this role, "close enough" is a failure.If you've read this, change the font color on your resume to Blue.Systemic Thinking: You love spreadsheets, color-coded statuses, and "If-This-Then-That" logic.Tech Fluency: High proficiency in data management tools (Airtable, Excel/Google Sheets) and the ability to quickly learn new ATS interfaces.Discretion: You will be handling the "keys" to a person’s professional life; integrity and security-mindedness are non-negotiable.

mbers and

, TikTok, Instagram)

/TikTok ad examples (REQUIRED to apply)

How to Apply

title: Full-Stack GenAI Developer
description:
Role Mission



We are seeking an elite Full-Stack GenAI Developer to design, build, and scale our next-generation agentic workflows. You are not just a coder; you are a systems thinker capable of bridging the gap between local LLM orchestration (Ollama/Jan.ai) and enterprise-grade cloud environments (GCP/AWS). Your mission is to build autonomous, self-healing systems that leverage the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and advanced graph-based reasoning to solve complex business challenges.



Technical Stack & Requirements



1. AI & Orchestration (The Core)



Agentic Frameworks: Expert-level proficiency in LangChain and LangGraph for stateful, multi-agent orchestration.Model Context Protocol (MCP): Hands-on experience implementing MCP to standardize tool-calling and context sharing across diverse models.Local & Open Ecosystems: Deep familiarity with local inference and development platforms including Ollama, Dify, Jan.ai, and Gorilla.Model Interoperability: Experience working with OpenClaw (or similar self-hosted agent runtimes) to execute system-level tasks via natural language.



2. Full-Stack Engineering & Cloud



Languages: Mastery of Python (FastAPI/Flask) for backend logic and AI integration.Cloud Infrastructure: Competency in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and AWS, specifically regarding Vertex AI, Lambda/Cloud Functions, and secure IAM/VPC configurations.Workspace Integration: Ability to build custom apps and automations within Google Workspace (Apps Script, Gmail/Drive APIs).



3. Data Extraction & RPA



Web Scraping: Advanced experience with Playwright, Selenium, or BeautifulSoup, including bypass techniques for sophisticated anti-bot measures.RPA (Robotic Process Automation): Building robust, browser-based or desktop-based automations that mimic human interaction where APIs are unavailable.API Architect: Designing and consuming complex REST/GraphQL APIs with a focus on rate-limiting, error handling, and data integrity.



Key Responsibilities



Architect Agentic Workflows: Design state machines using LangGraph that can reason, loop, and self-correct during complex multi-step tasks.Hardware-to-Cloud Bridging: Manage the lifecycle of models from local testing (Ollama) to production deployment on 
tomated Data Pipelines: Build resilient scrapers and RPA bots that feed real-time data into vector databases or agentic memory.System Integration: Use MCP to connect AI agents to internal tools, databases, and third-party SaaS platforms seamlessly.



Qualifications



5+ years of Full-Stack development experience.Proven track record of deploying production-grade AI agents (not just "wrappers").Deep understanding of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and vector database optimization.A "Builder" mindset: You contribute to open-source or have a portfolio of complex "side projects" that demonstrate your curiosity.



The Selection Process: Technical "Gauntlet"



Our vetting process involves a live coding challenge where you will be asked to:



Connect an AI agent to a live API using 
sign a brief LangGraph state machine to handle a multi-step research 
bug a failing web scraper in a containerized environment.



Work Environment



This is a fully virtual position offering flexibility to work from anywhere while maintaining collaborative relationships with tea
mbers and clients across various time zones.

Application Process



To be considered for this position, please visit: 



This position requires candidates to successfully complete our comprehensive evaluation process, which includes technical assessments and multiple interview stages to ensure the best fit for both the role and our organizational culture.

? AI Image & Design: Midjourney V6/V7, DALL-E 3 (ChatGPT image gen), Google Nano Banana, Flux, Adobe Firefly, Canva AI (Magic Studio), Ideogram 2.0, Reve, Freepik AI



? AI Video: Runway Gen-4.5 (Act-One), Kling AI 2.6, OpenAI Sora 2, Google Veo 3.1, Luma Ray3, HeyGen, Synthesia, CapCut AI, Wan (open-source), Invideo AI



? AI Writing & SEO: Jasper, SurferSEO (Surfer AI), Frase, Writesonic, Copy.ai, ChatGPT for long-form — you understand content optimization, SERP analysis, and AI-assisted editorial workflows



? AI Automation & Agents: Make (Integromat), Zapier (AI actions & Central), n8n (agentic workflows), Lindy.ai, Relevance AI, Vellum — building multi-step automations, AI agents, and workflows that connect apps and APIs



? AI Voice, Audio & Transcription: ElevenLabs (voice cloning & TTS), OpenAI Whisper, Otter.ai, Fireflies.ai, Descript, Notta, Fish Audio — for voice generation, meeting transcription, and audio editing



? AI Coding Assistants: Cursor, GitHub Copilot, Windsurf (Codeium), Claude Code, Replit Agent, v0 by Vercel, Bolt.new, Lovable — ability to build simple apps, scripts, automations, and internal tools with AI assistance



? AI Data & Analytics: Using AI (ChatGPT Advanced Data Analysis, Claude, Gemini) to analyze spreadsheets, create dashboards, generate reports, and extract actionable insights from complex data



? Prompt Engineering: Advanced prompt crafting, chain-of-thought prompting, system prompts, structured output techniques, multi-turn context management, and knowing how to get the best from each model



??????????????????????????????

WHAT SETS THE IDEAL CANDIDATE APART

??????????????????????????????



• You have an "AI-first" mindset — your default is to find an AI solution before doing anything manually

• You follow AI news daily (X/Twitter AI communities, YouTube channels, newsletters like Ben's Bites, The Neuron, The Rundown AI, etc.)

??????????????????????????????

NON-NEGOTIABLES

??????????????????????????????



???? Do NOT apply if you only have surface-level AI knowledge (e.g., you've "used ChatGPT a few times") - It will be incredibly challenging if not!

???? Do NOT apply if you cannot demonstrate real outputs created with AI tools

???? We will test your AI proficiency during the interview process — you will be given real tasks to complete using AI



??????????????????????????????

TO APPLY

??????????????????????????????

We're building a fast-moving, AI-driven operation and need someone who can keep up. If AI excites you and you're constantly experimenting with the latest tools, we want to hear from you.

description:

Our company has been trading successfully for over a decade. We have recently been made aware of potential concerns that competitors may be attempting to obtain sensitive information through illicit online sources.

We are therefore seeking an individual with strong expertise in deep and dark web research who can conduct a thorough review of publicly and privately accessible channels to identify what, if any, information may be circulating.

title: Part-Time Real Estate Cold Caller (Acquisitions) - $6/hr + $250 Commissions
description:
About Us



We’re a U.S.-based real estate investing company that buys properties directly from homeowners. Our business runs on integrity, speed, and strong communication. We’re building a small, elite team and we’re looking for a reliable, experienced real estate cold caller who wants consistent work and performance-based upside.



If you are honest, detail-oriented, hungry to win, and actually do what you say you will do — you’ll fit in perfectly here.





Position Overview



We are hiring a part-time Real Estate Cold Caller to call homeowners, check if they are interested in selling their house, collect basic property information, and schedule callbacks or appointments with our acquisitions (purchase) manager.



This is NOT a beginner role. You must already have successful real estate cold calling experience.





Responsibilities



• Call lists of homeowners using provided data and script

• Ask if they are interested in selling their property

• Build quick rapport and keep the conversation natural

• Ask basic qualifying questions and take accurate notes

• Tag and update call results correctly

• Schedule follow-up calls or appointments for interested sellers

• Communicate clearly with me and the team

• Be consistent, reliable, and professional every shift





Requirements (Please Read Carefully)



• Proven experience in real estate cold calling (acquisitions or lead gen)

• Confident, calm, and clear English speaking voice

• Fast, stable, and reliable internet connection

• Must be detail-oriented, honest, and organized

• Must be coach-able, positive, and have a can-do attitude

• Must be reliable and show up on time, every time

• Must be able to start by Tuesday at 3:00 PM U.S. EST

• Must have NO conflicting job or schedule during working hours

• Must be comfortable scheduling follow-ups and appointments

• Must communicate well and respond quickly





Work Schedule (U.S. EST)



• Monday – Thursday: 3:00 PM – 7:00 PM EST

• Friday: 2:00 PM – 6:00 PM EST

• Part-time, consistent weekly schedule





Compensation



• $6/hour + $250 commission per closed deal

• Paid regularly via Wise or PayPal

• Long-term opportunity for the right person

• Training and scripts provided





How to Apply (IMPORTANT – Follow Exactly)



To apply, you must:

 1. Send a message with the subject line:

“Real Estate Cold Caller – [Your Name]”

 2. Record a short voice sample of you saying this exact script:



“Hi, is this the owner of 123 Main Street? I was calling to see if you might be interested in selling your property there.”



 3. In your message, include:

• Your real estate cold calling experience (what you called, for who, and results if possible)

• What dialer/CRM you’ve used (Mojo, CallTools, Batch, Podio, etc.)

• Confirm you can work the exact schedule listed above

• Confirm you can start by Tuesday at 3 PM EST

• Confirm you are happy with $6/hr + commission

• Your internet speed and reliability



Applications without a voice recording will be ignored.





Who We’re Looking For



We want someone who is:

• Trustworthy

• Detail-oriented

• Fast learner

• Positive and hungry

• Calm, confident, and easy to talk to

• Coachable and consistent

• Actually does what they say they will do



If you’re just “trying” cold calling, this is not for you.

If you’re a real real estate cold caller who wants steady work + upside — we want you.

title: AI Video Production Specialist — YouTube Channel Builder | Reverse Engineering Successful Channels | Python | AI Coding
description:
# AI Video Production Specialist — YouTube Channel Builder | Channel Research & Replication | Python/AI Coding | Thumbnails | Automation



---



## Job Description



We run a growing network of YouTube channels producing AI-assisted video content at scale. We're looking for someone with an obsessive eye for detail who can take any successful YouTube channel as a reference and recreate everything about it — the thumbnail style, title format, video structure, pacing, transitions, fonts, colors, music choices, subtitle style, description format, tags, upload schedule — down to the last pixel. Then put it into production and move on to the next one.



This is a programming-heavy role. Our videos are built programmatically — Python scripts, FFmpeg, AI APIs, TTS engines, image generation pipelines, subtitle generators, and automated assembly. You're not dragging clips around in a timeline. You're writing and modifying code that produces videos. If you can't work in a terminal, read Python, and debug errors, this isn't for you.



---



## The Core Job



1. You actively research and find successful YouTube channels — both channels already using AI production and channels that aren't but could be replicated at scale using AI tools and automation. You identify opportunities and bring them to us.

2. I also send you YouTube channel or video references to replicate.

3. You study every single detail: thumbnail layout, font choices, color palette, text positioning, background style, title patterns, video length, intro style, pacing, music, voice tone, subtitle font/size/color/position, description template, tags, upload frequency, end screens, pinned comments — EVERYTHING.

4. You assess what can be automated vs what needs manual work, and determine if the channel format can be profitably produced at scale.

5. You document it all in a clear spec sheet.

6. You configure and code our production pipeline to replicate that exact style — using Python, Claude Code, and AI tools to build or modify scripts for thumbnails, TTS voiceovers, subtitle formatting, and video assembly.

7. You produce test videos and compare them side-by-side with the reference until they're indistinguishable in style and quality.

8. You launch the channel into production.

9. Repeat for the next channel.



---



## What You'll Be Doing Day-to-Day



- Researching and identifying successful YouTube channels that are either fully AI-produced or could be replicated at scale using AI — analyzing their niche, content format, view counts, growth trajectory, and production style to determine if they're viable targets

- Analyzing successful YouTube channels and breaking down exactly what makes them work (visual style, content structure, production quality, metadata strategy)

- Writing and modifying Python scripts using AI coding assistants (Claude Code, Cursor, etc.) to customize production pipelines for each channel's unique style

- Recreating thumbnail templates that match reference channels precisely (fonts, colors, layouts, image styles, text effects)

- Configuring TTS voice settings, subtitle styles, video pacing, and assembly parameters to match reference content

- Debugging and troubleshooting production code — reading error logs, fixing broken scripts, improving existing automation

- Quality-checking every output against the reference — catching details others would miss (wrong font weight, subtitle position off by a few pixels, color slightly wrong, pacing too fast)

- Managing video uploads, metadata, descriptions, tags, and scheduling across multiple channels

- Building new automation features and tools as needed

- Testing new AI tools and techniques to improve output quality



---



## Must-Haves



- Proven experience with AI video production — you have actually used AI tools AND code to produce video content at scale, not just plugged prompts into websites. You must be able to show examples.

- Experience programmatically creating video content or livestreams — using Python, FFmpeg, automation scripts, APIs, or similar tools to generate videos through code, not manual editing. If you've only ever used Premiere or CapCut by hand, this isn't the role.

- Python programming ability — you will be writing, reading, modifying, and debugging Python scripts daily. This includes working with APIs (TTS, image generation, AI models), FFmpeg commands, file processing, and automation logic. AI coding assistants like Claude Code will help you, but you still need to understand what the code is doing.

- Comfortable working in a terminal / command line (running scripts, SSH into servers, navigating folders, reading error logs, managing processes)

- Obsessive attention to detail — if you're the kind of person who notices when a font is 1px too large or a color is slightly off, you're our person. If you think "close enough" is good enough, this role isn't for you.

- Strong visual eye — you can look at a thumbnail and immediately identify the font, layout technique, color values, and effects used

- Understanding of YouTube (what makes channels successful, how the algorithm works, metadata optimization)

- Strong English communication skills

- Self-starter who figures things out independently

- Willing to use their own Claude Pro account for AI coding (we reimburse the $20/month subscription cost)



---



## Big Pluses



- Experience researching YouTube niches, analyzing channel performance, and identifying content opportunities

- Experience managing or growing YouTube channels

- Graphic design skills (Photoshop, Canva, Figma)

- FFmpeg knowledge

- Experience with TTS tools (ElevenLabs, Edge TTS, Kokoro, etc.)

- Linux servers / SSH / VPS management

- AI image generation experience (Stable Diffusion, Flux, Midjourney, DALL-E)

- Video editing in any NLE (Premiere, DaVinci Resolve, CapCut)

- Experience with subtitle/caption styling

- Git / version control basics

- Experience building or working with automation pipelines



---



## Work Details



- Position: Part-time (20 hours/week)

- Rate: $10 - $15 USD/hour depending on experience and skills

- Hours: Flexible schedule, must overlap with North American hours for communication

- Location: Remote (Philippines-based preferred)

- Start: Immediately

- Tools provided: Access to our servers, dashboards, and production systems. Claude Pro subscription reimbursed monthly.



---



## How to Apply



IMPORTANT: Applications that don't follow these instructions will be ignored.



Start your application message with the word KOKORO and include the phrase "blue dog" somewhere in your application to confirm you've read the entire posting.



Then answer these questions:



1. What is your experience with AI video production or programmatically creating video content? Describe the specific tools, scripts, or pipelines you've used. What did you build? How many videos were you producing? What was automated vs manual?



2. Go to this YouTube channel:

title: Recruiter and Onboarding Specialist (with US Healthcare Experience)
description:
Join Our Team :)



About the Role:

We are seeking a dynamic and organized Recruiter and Onboarding Specialist to join our growing team. In this dual-function role, you will be responsible for sourcing and hiring top talent while ensuring new hires have a smooth and engaging onboarding experience. You’ll play a key role in shaping a positive candidate journey from first contact through their successful integration into the company.



Key Responsibilities:

Recruitment (Talent Acquisition)

Collaborate with hiring managers to understand job requirements and candidate profiles.

Write and post job descriptions on internal and external job boards.

Source candidates through databases, LinkedIn, job boards, and referrals.

Screen resumes and conduct initial interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit.

Coordinate interview schedules and facilitate communication between candidates and hiring teams.

Maintain and update applicant tracking systems (e.g., Zoho Recruit, Greenhouse).

Manage the offer process, including negotiation and documentation.



Onboarding

Own the onboarding lifecycle from offer acceptance through Day 1 and beyond.

Prepare and send onboarding documents, equipment requests, and welcome kits.

Facilitate new hire orientation sessions and ensure timely completion of compliance documentation (e.g., I-9, W-4).

Coordinate with IT, Facilities, and other departments for system and workspace readiness.

Monitor and support employee integration during their first 30/60/90 days.

Solicit feedback from new hires to continuously improve the onboarding experience.



Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, or related field preferred.

2+ years of experience in recruiting and/or onboarding with remote client EXPERIENCE

Familiarity with ATS and HRIS systems (e.g., Justworks, Zoho, BambooHR).

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational and time management abilities.

Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

A passion for delivering an outstanding candidate and new hire experience.



Preferred Skills:

Experience recruiting in healthcare, tech, or a high-growth environment.

Knowledge of employment laws and onboarding best practices.

Comfortable working cross-functionally with hiring managers and HR teams.



Technology Requirement:

Minimum 80 mbps Internet Speed

Minimum intel i5 8th gen with 8GB of RAM

Webcam and Headset

Designated Office Space in your home



Perks of the Job:

Very competitive salary

Fully Remote WFH Setup

Paid Time Off 10 days

Opportunity for professional growth and development

A supportive and inclusive work environment where your voice is heard and your ideas are valued



Ready to Join the Team?

If you're ready to be the heartbeat of our HR department and make a meaningful impact on our organization, we want to hear from you! Send us your resume and tell us why you're the perfect fit for the role.

Don't miss your chance to be part of something extraordinary. Apply now and let's shape the future of HR together!

title: Rockstar Real Estate VA Needed (Deal Finder + Builder Outreach for Land Wholesaling JV Deals))
description:

 follow-up process to get buy boxes + buyer interest. You’ll be working using the platforms and
 templates we provide.



Your responsibilities will include:

1. Find JV land deals under contract using our deal platform/community (filter by market/zip/county, pull key deal notes, and log them). 

2. Find and verify builders in the same area (confirm they’re real home builders and not unrelated companies with similar names). 

3. Collect builder contact details (land acquisition specialist / owner / founder when possible):
 + phone number, and record them cleanly in our tracker. 

4. Verify
s using a free
 verification tool, and replace bad/incorrect
s when needed by researching the correct contact. 

5. Send
 sequences + follow-ups from our business
 (templates provided), ask for the builder’s buy box, and track replies + next steps. 



Required technical skills and experience:

To qualify for the position, you need at least 1 year experience with:

1. Real estate research / lead sourcing (builders, developers, investors, or similar) 

2.
 outreach + follow-up tracking (Gmail + organizing replies, follow-ups, and statuses) 

3. Web research + contact verification (finding correct decision-makers + validating
 accuracy) 



This role moves fast and requires clean execution. You should be:

1. Very detail-oriented (names, markets,
s must be correct)

2. Comfortable following processes (templates + steps exactly)

3. Proactive (if something doesn’t match, you investigate and fix it)



Basic skills:

1. Strong English reading/writing

2. Web research (Google/LinkedIn)

3. Gmail + Google Sheets

4. Basic spreadsheet organization (filters, sorting, clean formatting)



Desired technical skills and experience (not required, but a big plus):

1. Experience working with US home builders / land acquisition contacts

2. Familiarity with CRM-style tracking (statuses, pipelines, follow-up cadence)

3. Comfort making light outbound texts



Work schedule and holidays:

1. Part-time (20 hrs/week)

2. Monday-Friday

3. 4 hours/day



Salary:

$160/month + performance-based bonuses 



Perks and benefits:

1. Opportunity to turn into a full-time (40 hrs/week) role

2. Performance bonuses

3. Clear SOPs + templates provided so you’re not guessing



Trainings provided:

1. Access to the platforms

2. The exact
 templates + follow-up sequence

3. A simple step-by-step SOP for verifying builders +
s and logging everything 



Career potential

If you do well, you can grow into a manager role and eventually help manage other VAs and oversee pipeline tracking



Details on how to apply:

When applying, put “Builder JV VA” in the subject line



In your application, answer these 3 questions:

1. What tools have you used for lead research (real estate or otherwise)?

2. If you find a builder

?

3. Confirm your internet speed and your available working hours (CST)

title: YouTube Long-Form Editor
description:
I’m on a mission to create world-class educational content that helps people to start and monetise their personal brand online. I’m passionate about this because so many people have knowledge and experiences that need to be shared.

 

Location: Remote

Commitment: Part-Time to Full-Time (2 videos/week)

Please Read Before Applying

This role is only for a high-level, YouTube-first video editor. Please only apply if you have a portfolio ready that shows you can edit to the standard we’re looking for.



About the Role

We're looking for a highly-skilled Video Editor who is passionate about storytelling, loves YouTube, and wants to collaborate long-term to grow a channel focused on content creation and sharing the behind-the-scenes of building a business.



You’ll work closely with the creator (Joe Gannon) in a newly formed Brand Team to publish 2 YouTube videos per week - one a talking-head educational video and the other may be a vlog.



What You'll Do

- Edit 2x long-form YouTube videos per week (length of video TBD)

- Own the production calendar and schedule to ensure a consistent posting time for our audience (we will obsess over how to create a community)

- Help evolve the visual style of the channel

- Occasionally support the wider business on client work (editing YouTube videos, podcasts, or short-form clips) and also wider marketing promo videos for the business

- Stay sharp on creator trends, YouTube content pacing, storytelling styles



My Channel 



You're a Great Fit If You...

- Can emulate educational channels like Ali Abdaal, Shan Hanif, Sahil Bloom and Jay Clouse. For vlogs I like Mr. FourToEight and Sahil Bloom (before he hired a videographer)

- Take creative initiative - not just a task-taker, but a storytelling partner

- Are highly organized and meet deadlines with ease

- Want to grow with a personal brand long-term and take ownership of your work



Success Metrics / KPIs

- 2x videos delivered weekly, on time and within brand standards

- Increasing creative alignment with the brand’s evolving style

- Improved retention through better pacing, hook delivery, and storytelling

- Proactive input during ideation and thumbnail conversations

- Organization: clear file management, streamlined workflows



If interested apply to this link:

title: Real Estate Cold Caller – Acquisitions (Experienced, $4.50/hr, Full Time)
description:
Real Estate Cold Caller – Acquisitions (Experienced, $4.50/hr, Full Time)



About Us:

We’re a U.S.-based real estate investing company that buys and sells properties. Our team values honesty, communication, and consistent growth. We create a positive and focused work environment where everyone contributes to results and long-term success.



We’re looking for a motivated and experienced Cold Caller who is enthusiastic, reliable, and ready to start immediately.



Position Overview:



We’re hiring an upbeat, confident, and disciplined Real Estate Cold Caller to contact motivated sellers and qualify leads. You must have prior experience in real estate cold calling (acquisitions), a positive personality, and strong English communication skills.



You should enjoy talking with people, be comfortable handling objections, and follow scripts effectively while sounding natural.





Responsibilities:



• Call property owners using a power dialer (e.g., Mojo, CallTools, or similar)

• Use provided scripts to qualify motivated seller leads

• Build rapport, ask qualifying questions, and take accurate notes

• Update CRM and spreadsheets with detailed call results

• Set appointments or send warm leads to the acquisitions manager

• Attend team check-ins and follow direction carefully





Requirements:



• Previous real estate cold calling experience required (acquisitions or lead generation)

• Experience using Mojo Dialer, CallTools, or similar autodialer

• Excellent spoken English with a neutral or light accent

• Stable and fast internet connection (you will be tested)

• Available to work Monday–Friday, 12 PM–6 PM U.S. EST

• Positive, confident, and upbeat voice and attitude

• Reliable, self-motivated, and comfortable working independently

• Must be ready to start immediately and committed long-term

• Must be happy and willing to work for the pay offered





Compensation & Schedule:



• $4.50/hour, full-time (30–35 hours per week minimum)

• Paid biweekly via PayPal or Wise

• Training and ongoing support provided

• Long-term position with room for growth based on performance





To Apply:

 1. Send a message with the subject line: “Cold Caller – [Your Name]”

 2. Include a brief voice recording introducing yourself (required)

 3. Share your previous real estate cold calling experience, including what type of leads you called and what tools you used (e.g., Mojo, CallTools, Podio, etc.)

 4. Explain why you want this position and confirm you meet all requirements above

 5. Confirm your internet speed, availability (12 PM–6 PM EST), and that you are happy with $4.50/hour





We’re looking for someone who’s hungry to grow, loves talking to people, and can represent our company with professionalism and positivity. If that’s you — we’d love to meet you!



Thank you,

Cory

title: UX / Product Designer (Healthcare App Demo – Figma Prototype)
description:
Overview



We’re building a partner-ready demo for a new healthcare-focused app. This is not a full build at this stage. We need a UX/Product Designer who can take a concept, shape the user journey, and produce a high-quality clickable prototype that clearly communicates value to partners.



You’ll work closely with the founder to define the MVP scope, design core flows, and deliver a prototype we can use in stakeholder conversations.



Project Goal



Create a polished, partner-ready demo (primarily in Figma) including user flows, screens, and a clickable prototype. The outcome should feel like a real product, even if it uses mocked data.



Responsibilities



Turn early-stage requirements into clear user journeys and MVP scope



Create user flows for key scenarios (e.g., onboarding, key task completion, dashboard, messaging/updates, basic admin if needed)



Produce wireframes and then high-fidelity UI for mobile (and web if required)



Build a clickable Figma prototype suitable for partner demos



Create a simple design system (components, typography, spacing, UI patterns) to keep screens consistent



Write basic UX copy for key screens (clear, calm, human)



Ensure designs consider privacy and sensitive health context (no dark patterns, sensible consent points)



Collaborate asynchronously, iterate quickly based on feedback, and document decisions



Deliverables (What “done” looks like)



MVP scope and key assumptions captured (1–2 pages)



User flows (Figma/FigJam)



Wireframes for core screens



High-fidelity UI for core screens



Clickable prototype covering the end-to-end demo journey



Component library / mini design system



Handoff notes for a developer (if we move to build)



Required Skills & Experience



Strong portfolio showing mobile app UX and product thinking



Excellent Figma skills (Auto Layout, components, variants, prototyping)



Ability to simplify complex workflows into intuitive steps



Experience designing for sensitive, high-trust domains (healthcare, fintech, insurance, gov, etc.) is a plus



Comfortable working from rough briefs and shaping clarity



Strong communication and ability to explain design rationale



Nice to Have



Experience with healthcare UX, accessibility, consent patterns



Knowledge of iOS/Android design conventions



Ability to produce a lightweight demo script/storyboard for stakeholder presentations



Basic understanding of developer handoff and feasibility constraints



Working Style



Remote, async-friendly



Regular check-ins via WhatsApp/Slack + Loom walkthroughs



Quick iterations and practical decision-making



Time & Budget



Initial engagement: [2–4 weeks] (can extend)



Hours: [10–20 hrs/week] or fixed-price by milestone



Please include your rate and availability



How to Apply (Important)



Please send:



Portfolio link (must include mobile app work)



2–3 relevant examples and what your role was



Your Figma proficiency level



Availability in the next 2 weeks



A short note: how you would approach creating a partner demo prototype from a rough idea

title: Lead List Building Specialist (Clay + Apollo Expert)
description:
Job Title

Lead Research & List Building Specialist — Clay + Apollo Expert (Full-Time)

Salary

$800–$1,200 USD/month (based on experience)

Schedule

Full-time, Monday–Friday, 40 hours/week. Flexible hours but must overlap with Eastern Standard Time (EST) for at least 3–4 hours daily.

About Us

Windsor Drake is a mergers & acquisitions (M&A) advisory firm based in Canada. We help founders of established businesses ($1M–$20M+ in revenue) sell their companies to qualified buyers. We are building a high-volume outbound sales machine and need someone exceptional to own our lead research and list building operations.

This is not a generic VA role. You will be the engine behind a 4-person outbound sales team. The quality of the lists you build directly determines whether our team books meetings or wastes their day calling the wrong people. If you're great at this, you'll have a massive impact on a fast-growing company.

What You'll Be Doing

Your core job is to build hyper-targeted, enriched lead lists of Canadian business owners and potential buyers using Clay, Apollo, and other research tools.

Specifically:



Build and maintain lead lists in Clay and Apollo targeting Canadian founders and business owners in specific sectors (manufacturing, HVAC, construction, healthcare services, tech, professional services, etc.)

Enrich every lead with: verified direct
, direct cell phone number, LinkedIn profile URL, company revenue estimate, employee count, years in business, founder tenure, business sector/industry

Cross-reference and verify data using LinkedIn Sales Navigator, company websites, government business registries, and other online sources

Segment and tag lists by geography (province/city), industry, revenue range, employee count, and founder characteristics

Clean and deduplicate data before importing to HubSpot CRM

Continuously test new data sources, Clay enrichment workflows, and Apollo search filters to improve list quality and hit rate

Track list performance metrics (which lists lead to the most booked meetings) and optimize accordingly

Research and identify potential buyer leads (private equity firms, strategic acquirers, family offices, search funds) targeting Canadian businesses



Tools You Must Know

Required — must have hands-on experience with:



Clay (building tables, enrichment workflows, waterfall enrichment, AI prompts within Clay, integrations)


 (advanced search filters, saved searches, list building, data export, sequence setup)

LinkedIn Sales Navigator (boolean search, lead lists, account lists)

HubSpot CRM (importing contacts, list management, custom properties, basic workflows)

Google Sheets / Excel (data cleaning, deduplication, VLOOKUP, formatting for CRM import)



Nice to have:



Experience with other enrichment tools (ZoomInfo, Clearbit, Lusha, RocketReach, BuiltWith, Crunchbase)

Familiarity with Canadian business databases (Industry Canada, provincial business registries)

Experience supporting outbound sales teams or SDR/BDR teams

Understanding of the M&A industry or business brokerage

Zapier or 
 for automating data flows



Who You Are



You are obsessed with data quality. You'd rather spend an extra 30 minutes verifying 50 leads than hand over a list with bad phone numbers and wrong
s. You take pride in clean, accurate data.

You are resourceful and creative. When Apollo doesn't have a phone number, you don't stop — you check Clay enrichment, LinkedIn, the company website, Canada411, provincial registries, whatever it takes to find it.

You are organized and systematic. You build repeatable processes, not one-off lists. You document your workflows so they can scale.

You can work independently. We'll give you targeting criteria and you'll go build the lists without needing to be micromanaged.

You communicate clearly. If a list isn't coming together well or you're hitting dead ends in a sector, you tell us proactively — not after wasting 3 days.

You understand that your work directly impacts revenue. When you deliver a great list, our team books meetings. When the list is bad, they waste their day. You take that seriously.



What Success Looks Like

Within your first 30 days:



You've built Clay workflows for our top 3 target sectors

You've delivered your first 500+ enriched, verified leads to HubSpot

Our outbound team is calling your lists and booking meetings



Within 90 days:



You've built a repeatable system for producing 1,000+ new enriched leads per month across multiple sectors and geographies

You're tracking which list segments convert best and proactively recommending where to focus

You've identified and tested at least 2–3 new data sources or enrichment methods beyond Apollo and Clay

Our team never runs out of people to call



How to Apply

Do NOT send a generic application. We will ignore it.

Instead, send us a short Loom video (3–5 minutes max) where you:



Show us a Clay table you've built for a previous client or project — walk us through the enrichment workflow you set up, what data sources you used, and why

Show us an Apollo search you've built — explain the filters you chose and how you'd refine it for targeting Canadian business owners with $2M–$10M in revenue

Tell us one thing most people get wrong about lead list building and what you do differently



If you don't have Clay experience but are very strong in Apollo + LinkedIn Sales Navigator and are confident you can learn Clay quickly, still apply — but be honest about it in your video.

Applications without a Loom video will not be reviewed.

Why This Role Is Different

This isn't data entry. This isn't scraping random
s. You'll be the person who determines which Canadian founders our team talks to every single day. The data you build becomes a long-term strategic asset for our company. You'll work directly with the founder (not through 3 layers of management), get real feedback on how your lists perform, and have a clear line of sight between your work and the company's growth.

If you're the kind of person who gets excited about building the perfect lead list and seeing it convert into real business, we want to talk to you.

title: Short-Form Video Editor for US-Based Health Creator Part-Time to Full-Time
description:
Hi! I’m Dr. Eileen, an acupuncturist and content creator based in the USA. My 
 has 900K+ followers and I’m reviving a cold account/returning to consistent content creation. I need a reliable, skilled video editor to help me produce 3–5 short-form reels per week. I’ve been editing my own content up until now, but I am a full time new mom and clinician so I don't have a lot of time anymore. I know exactly what I want — I just need someone to execute faster than I can now.



I’m looking for someone long-term — not a one-off gig. If you’re reliable, creative, and understand pacing, we’ll work well together. 



Your responsibilities:

• Edit talking head reels (cuts, captions, music, pacing)

• Edit demo reels (acupressure/gua sha techniques — close-ups, zooms, text callouts)

• Create B-roll + voiceover reels (stitch clinic footage, demo with my narration)

• Create simple text-led reels (text overlay + trending audio)

• Design carousel slides in Canva



Must-haves:

• Experience editing short-form vertical video (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts). 

• Strong understanding of hook pacing and retention

• Clean caption/subtitle styling

• Good music/sound selection instincts

• Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

• Reliable communication via WhatsApp, Slack, or Google Chat

• Can deliver within 48–72 hours per reel

• Consistent internet and ability to upload/download large files



Nice-to-haves:

- Experience with health, wellness, or educational content creators

- Canva skills for carousels

- An understanding of IG/TikTok trends and algorithm

- Would also love to hire for long form content for Youtube when I get there!

-Familiarity with Notion or other task management platforms (Notion is where I script and brain dump)



Volume:

• Month 1: ~12+ reels/month (about x3-5 videos/week)

• Month 2+: ~20 reels/month (goal is to consistently landing at 5 videos/week)

• Potential to grow into full-time with additional platforms (YouTube long-form, etc.)



How to Apply/Please send me:

1. A link to 2–3 short-form reels you’ve edited (health/wellness preferred, but educational content works too)

2. Your monthly rate expectation (full transparency, I like to do a trial week before we scale)

3. Your editing software of choice (I mainly use capcut)

4. A brief note on why you’d be a good fit

5. A few suggestions on how you operate, where to land RAW files, and how I should film/organize so that it will help both of us to be efficient

6. How often are we communicating (I operate in real-time unless I'm with my family or with patients)

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) for Modern Media Agency
description:
We are Cropt, a high-end media agency helping businesses scale through elite promotional videos and creative ad carousels. We are looking for a hungry, persistent, and organized SDR to be the "engine" of our growth. You won't just be calling names on a list; you will be identifying the right businesses, finding the decision-makers, and booking high-value meetings.



What You’ll Do

Strategic Research: Build your own daily lead lists of businesses (gyms, real estate, retail) that are missing high-quality video content.



High-Volume Outreach: Make 40–60 outbound calls and send personalized follow-up
s/DMs daily.



Lead Qualification: Use our "Pain Point" checklist to ensure you are only booking meetings with businesses that have the budget and need for our services.



Pipeline Management: Maintain a clean CRM to track every conversation and follow-up.



Required Skills

Elite Communication: Near-native English with a confident, neutral accent.



Grit: You handle "No" with a smile and know that it takes an average of 5+ follow-ups to get a "Yes".



Self-Starter: You don't need a boss breathing down your neck to find leads and hit your numbers.



Experience: At least 1–2 years in outbound sales, cold calling, or appointment setting.



Why Join Cropt?

Competitive Base + Performance Bonuses: We reward results. If you book a meeting that closes, you get paid a significant success fee.



Modern Agency Vibe: We aren't a corporate dinosaur. We are fast-paced, creative, and value your input on our sales playbook.



Growth Potential: We are a startup. As we grow, the people who helped us get there will have opportunities to lead the sales team.



Send a voice recording (Vocaroo or Loom) introducing yourself and telling us about your biggest "win" in cold calling.

About the Role



We’re looking for a talented Graphic Designer to join our team on a part-time basis (starting at 10 hours per week), with the potential to scale hours as we grow.



This is a mixed, hands-on role where you’ll design across multiple projects and clients. You’ll work closely with our team to support motion design projects, brand assets, and digital content for SaaS and B2B companies.



The pace is fast, but the work stays interesting — and there’s strong potential for long-term career growth for the right person.



What You’ll Be Doing

Preparing assets for motion design



Creating high-quality graphic assets to support motion and digital content



Working on SaaS and B2B design projects



Collaborating with a remote team and communicating clearly about tasks and timelines



Continuously improving your skills, portfolio, and creative output
