Great communication skills and reliability



Someone who enjoys variety and working on multiple projects



A designer who’s motivated to grow, improve, and create outstanding work



Comfortable working in a fast-paced, remote environment



Experience with Adobe Creative Suite



Trial Opportunity



We also have a paid gig opportunity starting next week, acting as a trial of up to 40 hours.



How to Apply



Please include:

A link to your portfolio



Why you see yourself working with MoveUP



We’re excited to meet designers who want to grow with us and do great work

title: MEDIA BUYER LEAD GEN
description:
Performance Media Buyer - Medspa Lead Generation

Remote (Philippines-based) | $1,500-2,500/month base + performance bonuses

About the Role

We're scaling our medspa marketing agency to $100K/month and need a media buyer who understands that leads mean nothing if they don't book appointments.

You'll manage Meta ad campaigns for 5-8 medspa clients (starting with 2-3 during onboarding), working closely with our appointment-setting team to optimize the entire funnel from click to booked call.

What Success Looks Like



Month 1-2: Takeover existing campaigns, maintain current performance while learning client goals

Month 3-4: Improve booking rates by 15-20% through funnel optimization

Month 6+: Own 6-8 clients independently, contributing to agency growth targets



Core Responsibilities (70% of your time)



Launch and optimize Meta ad campaigns focused on appointment bookings, not just leads

Monitor daily performance: CPL, CPA, booking rates, and lead quality metrics

A/B test ad copy, creatives, audiences, and offers based on what actually converts downstream

Weekly collaboration with appointment setters to understand which leads book and why



Funnel Optimization (20% of your time)



Build and edit landing pages in GoHighLevel (we'll train you on our templates)

Set up tracking pixels and UTM parameters to measure full-funnel performance

Identify conversion bottlenecks between ad click ? landing page ? booked appointment



Creative Support (10% of your time)



Make basic edits to ad graphics in Canva

Trim/edit short-form video ads using simple tools (CapCut or similar)

Collaborate with our creative team on high-performing ad concepts



You're a Strong Fit If:



You've run Meta lead gen campaigns where you were accountable for appointment bookings or sales calls (not just e-commerce or brand awareness)

You understand why a $30 lead that books 50% is better than a $15 lead that ghosts

You're comfortable with GoHighLevel or similar funnel builders (or excited to learn)

You can set up
 Pixel tracking without needing a developer

You've worked with appointment setters or call centers and understand lead quality issues

You're available during 8am-12pm EST overlap for team collaboration



Bonus Points For:



Experience with local service businesses (medspa, dental, home services, med spas, aesthetics)

Background at a lead gen agency (not just in-house or freelance)

Familiarity with direct response marketing principles

Managed multiple clients simultaneously



What We Offer

Compensation:



Base: $1,500-2,500/month (based on experience)

Performance bonuses: uncapped based on client booking targets

Realistic total comp: $3,500-4,500/month



Growth Path:



Month 6: Senior Media Buyer ($3,500-4,500 base)

Month 12: Lead Media Buyer managing junior buyers ($5,000+ base)



Work Environment:



Remote-first team

Core hours: 8am-12pm EST overlap required, flexible otherwise

Monthly 1-on-1 career development calls

Access to premium training resources (we invest in your skills)



What We Don't Need



Someone who only knows how to duplicate campaigns without understanding the strategy

Media buyers who've only run e-commerce or brand awareness campaigns

People who think "I delivered leads" is enough without caring if they converted



Our Clients

We work exclusively with medspas and aesthetic clinics across the US, helping them fill their calendars with qualified consultation bookings for services like Botox, fillers, body contouring, and skin treatments.

Average client ad spend: $1,500-2,000/month

Current agency ad spend: ~$45,000/month across 30 clients

Your initial portfolio: 2-3 clients, scaling to 6-8 within 6 months



How to Apply



Visit: 
/mbs

description:
Hello,



We are an e-commerce industrial supply company in the USA. We have multiple websites which are all very similar. Currently we are only doing Google and Bing Ads to drive traffic to our websites. All of our websites are on the Shopify platform.



We want to start SEO and develop a long term SEO plan.



We are hiring for a full time, long term SEO / SEM Expert who will help get our websites top placement on the major search engines. This is a full time position for 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week.



Requirements for this position:



- Multiple years of SEO experience (5 years or more)

- Develop and implement an SEO plan for our websites with measurable results

- Regularly present deliverables to owner (show us what SEO work is being done)

- Ability to teach and manage a team of other employees who will work on SEO

- Proven track record of SEO success with other e-commerce company

- Great English speaking and writing skills

- Long term position (we want this person to be with us for years)

- Full time positions. 8 hours per day. Monday to Friday

- Extreme attention to details (THIS IS A MUST)

- Honest and Loyal

- WILL NOT DISAPPEAR

- Knows how to use

- Reliable internet connection



To make sure you have fully read this job description in your application
 please include this as the first line: "I am the perfect SEO MASTER!!!"



Thank You

Neil

title: Extremely Detail Oriented Virtual Assistant - Data Entry & Order Fulfillment
description:
Hello,



I have a small e-commerce industrial supply company in the USA. We receive orders on our websites and we place those order with our vendors on their websites who drop ships the order directly to our customers. We are the distributor (also called the "middleman" by some people). You will be working directly with me (the owner) everyday.



You will reply to emails that come into our general sales inbox. Most of these emails are to check stock availability and price of items.



You will make 10-20 phone calls per day to our vendors to check availability of items and also call customers if additional details are required about their order.



You will place orders online with our vendors which will drop ship direct to our customers.



We are hiring for a full time, long term Virtual Assistant who will enter new orders on our vendors websites and also enter tracking information to fill orders on our websites. This position will work 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week Monday - Friday during USA hours (10pm-6pm Manila time). You must be exclusive to this job, you cannot do other work or side jobs if hired. Your full concentration must be on this job.



Requirements for this position:



- CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS / COMMON SENSE

- Fast on the computer, writing emails and using internet

- Great English speaking and writing skills

- Long term position (we want this person to be with us for years)

- 10pm-6am daily Manila time. Monday to Friday

- Extreme attention to details (THIS IS A MUST)

- Excellent with numbers and math

- Excellent with Data entry

- Honest and Loyal

- Willing to learn and ask questions

- WILL NOT DISAPPEAR

- Expert working on a computer

- Expert using email (Gmail)

- Expert using the internet and placing orders online

- Great with Microsoft Excel and Word

- Knows how to use Skype

- Reliable internet connection



A very simple explanation of this job: You will take the orders we receive on our websites (you will receive order details by email) and place those orders with our vendors on their websites. EXTREME ATTENTION TO DETAILS & NUMBERS is required.



Over time you will receive additional responsibilities but it will also be related to processing and filling orders. 10-20 times per day you may need to call/email vendors for stock and price check. 10-20 times per day you may need to call/email our customers to provide lead time or order updates.



Once our vendor has shipped the order you will take the UPS / Fedex tracking numbers and you will fill orders. This is not a complicated job but you must be extremely detail oriented.

- We must ship the correct items to our customers

- We must ship to correct item quantity to our customers

- We must ship to the correct customer address





To make sure you have fully read this job description in your application email please include this in the subject and as the first line: "I am ok to work from 10pm - 6am weekdays and commit to doing so for 5 years or more. I am the perfect VA001!!!"



Thank You

Neil

title: Construction Administrator
description:
I am a general contractor in Phoenix Arizona, USA. I manage around 3 projects at a time, both residential and commercial and 7 figures of revenue per year. I am looking for someone with a deep understanding of construction and finances to be an administrator for our team. 



We need someone who will help my team stay organized in contractor foreman, an application used to send quotes, invoices, keep track of receipts and finances, labor hours, etc. I also need someone with an understanding of construction who can help us order materials to ensure that my crew has what they need to complete a job.



This is a smaller company, so the responsibilities may grow as we get bigger. My team speaks spanish so if you speak spanish, that can be helpful, but not required. 



I am looking for someone very experience, and will pay accordingly. Depending on experience this job can pay $6 per hour or more.

title: Customer Support for eCom Jewelry Brand
description:
Join the team building the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life. 



We’re looking for people who genuinely care about customers, take ownership, and want to deliver an experience most brands don’t.



At BALANZI, you’ll be responsible for turning problems into trust and making sure every customer walks away feeling respected, taken care of, and confident that we stand behind our word.



Start here: 



Watch this short video from the founders to understand how we think about customer experience, integrity, and why support is a moat for our brand.



Role Overview 



- Role: Customer Support (Junior) 

- Location: Fully remote

- Schedule: Monday-Saturday (6 days/week) with flexible hours

- Compensation: $500/month (+$100 if you work Sundays, optional)



We put a premium on authenticity and integrity. We don’t want corporate personas or scripted support, we want real people who show up as themselves and care about doing the right thing.



This role is about thinking proactively, putting yourself in the customer’s shoes, and going above and beyond by default, not just reacting to tickets.



Integrity here means a “pick up the trash” mindset. If something is wrong, no matter how small or who caused it, you fix it without being asked.



The goal is simple: customers should walk away thinking, “Why isn’t every brand like this?” Feeling confident, respected, and genuinely taken care of.



When someone buys from BALANZI, they should feel one thing above all else: we stand behind our word.



Who This Is Really For



- You thrive in high standards

- You take REAL ownership 

- You learn fast and figure things out

- You perform best when the stakes are real 

- You care about building something meaningful 

- You’re willing to get your hands dirty to move the mission forward



Our Core Values



The right person for this role will connect deeply with our values, live them daily, and understand why they’re essential for building something great.



No Compromises – You never compromise on anything, from product to customer experience.



Ultimate Perseverance – You don’t stop. The challenge doesn’t matter; there’s always a solution to a problem. 



Extreme Ownership – You take full ownership. You care about the details and deliver work you’re proud to put your name on.



If these values don’t feel like a natural fit, please do not apply. 



Main Responsibilities: 



- Handle all customer communication in Gorgias across
, SMS, Instagram DMs,
 messages, and social comments



- Maintain first response time under 1 hour and resolution within 2-4 hours whenever possible



- Process refunds, exchanges, and warranty claims accurately, including cases covered under our Lifetime Money-Back Guarantee



- Respond to Trustpilot reviews, on-site reviews, and public customer feedback in a way that builds trust and reinforces brand credibility



- Communicate directly with our 3PL to resolve fulfillment issues, stock questions, mis-shipments, and delivery problems



- Work with carriers and manufacturers to resolve shipping delays, lost packages, and transit-related issues



- Monitor and manage paid ad comments by answering questions, addressing concerns, and escalating issues when needed



- Proactively identify recurring customer issues, bottlenecks, or risks and flag them before they become problems



- Operate with an ownership-first mindset, fixing issues without being asked and ensuring customers always feel taken care of



Prior Experience / Skills



- No experience required. We hire for potential, not experience

- What matters most is how you perform during the 14-day trial

- Familiarity with Shopify, Gorgias (or other help desks), or working with a 3PL is a plus, but not required



About Us 



BALANZI exists to build the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life - so that men can move through life feeling confident, without ever needing to take off their chain or change who they are.



Founded in 2020, we didn’t start with a big mission. We chased money, sold products we didn’t believe in, and eventually realized we hated what we were building. So we scrapped everything and kept only one thing: Cuban Links - the only product our customers truly loved.



Over the last 12 months, we’ve rebuilt BALANZI from the ground up: redesigned products, raised our quality standards, refined our positioning, and committed fully to becoming the #1 destination for Cuban Links.



Today, we’re a small, passionate team focused on excellence, long-term thinking, and building a brand we’re truly proud of; never compromising on product, customer experience, or our team.



Why Work For BALANZI? 



- Your work has real impact, and it will directly shape BALANZI and its future

- You work directly with the founders, not buried under layers of management

- You’ll have real ownership, autonomy, and the ability to move the needle fast

- You’ll grow faster here than in any traditional environment 



You’ll join a team with high standards, no bureaucracy, and a clear mission we believe in



If this gets you fired up, then click below and apply now.

## COMPENSATION & GROWTH

ABOUT US

## WHY THIS IS DIFFERENT

title: Real Estate Acquisitions (+Bonuses!)
description:
Real Estate Acquisitions Specialist (Remote)



About Us

Price Real Estate Investments is a multi-market U.S. based real estate investment company focused on acquiring off-market properties directly from homeowners. We specialize in building strong relationships with sellers, negotiating with them, and closing deals virtually. Our team is fully remote, but our impact is nationwide — and we’re growing quickly.



We’re looking for an experienced Real Estate Acquisitions Specialist to join our acquisitions team. This role is critical to our business: you’ll be speaking directly with homeowners, negotiating terms, and guiding sellers through the contract signing process. If you’ve personally made offers to sellers and closed contracts over the phone, this is an opportunity to put your skills to work in a high-energy, professional environment.



Compensation

$10/hour USD base pay



Plus Monthly Contract Bonuses for getting offers accepted:

• Bronze: 2 signed contracts = $500 bonus

• Silver: 3 signed contracts = $1,000 bonus

• Gold: 4 signed contracts = $1,500 bonus

• Platinum: 5+ signed contracts = $2,000 bonus



On-target earnings can range from $2,500–$3,500+ per month depending on performance. Pay dates are on the 1st and 15th of each month.



We believe in rewarding results. Our top performers earn meaningful bonuses based on closed contracts and consistent production.



Schedule

Full-time, Monday to Friday

9:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST

Remote position, work from your own secure setup



What You’ll Be Doing

- Engage with homeowners (seller leads), build authentic rapport, and manage conversations with professionalism

- Follow a proven acquisitions script while sounding natural and confident

- Ask strong follow-up questions to uncover seller motivation and property condition

- Make verbal offers, negotiate price and terms, and walk sellers through agreements using DocuSign

- Handle objections effectively and push deals forward toward signed contracts

- Maintain organized notes, offers, and seller updates in our CRM

- Collaborate closely with the acquisitions team and leadership



What It Takes to Succeed Here

- Relentless Follow-Up: Sellers don’t always respond the first time — or the second. You know how to stay persistent with calls, texts, and follow-ups until you get an answer. Nothing slips through the cracks on your watch.

- Extreme Attention to Detail: Every call, every note, every update gets logged correctly in the CRM. You don’t miss details, and you take pride in keeping your pipeline organized. If you’ve ever been called meticulous or “on top of everything,” this is where you’ll shine.

- Closer’s Mentality: You’re not just reading a script — you know how to listen, build rapport, and guide sellers toward a decision. You thrive on negotiation, handle objections with confidence, and create win-win agreements that get signed.

- Driven by Results: You measure success by contracts closed. You hold yourself to high standards and push to hit — and exceed — your targets consistently. You’re motivated by performance and driven by the satisfaction of closing successful deals.

- Resilient Problem-Solver: Whether it’s a tough seller, a pricing objection, or a complicated situation, you don’t freeze — you find solutions and move the deal forward. Challenges are part of the role, and you thrive in solving them under pressure.



Requirements

- Minimum 2+ years of experience in real estate acquisitions or seller negotiations

- Proven track record of closing real estate deals and securing signed contracts

- Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written)

- Confidence and professionalism on the phone; ability to build trust and rapport quickly

- Familiarity with real estate terms like ARV, repairs, inspection, contingencies, etc.

- Strong work ethic, coachability, and ability to follow scripts while sounding natural

- Proficiency with CRMs and outbound dialers

- Reliable high-speed internet, updated computer, and a quiet workspace



What We’re Looking For

- A confident, friendly, and persuasive communicator who thrives on results

- Someone who is organized, detail-oriented, and relentless in follow-up

- A professional with the drive to close contracts and grow with a fast-moving team



Why Join Us?

- Competitive pay with structured bonuses

- Real opportunities for growth in a professional investment company

- Work remotely with a team that supports your success

- A chance to close real deals, make a real impact, and develop long-term career skills in acquisitions



At Price Real Estate Investments, acquisitions is the heartbeat of our business. You’ll be in the front seat, driving growth and learning the strategies that power real deals across multiple U.S. markets.

title: Virtual Assistant (Remote – Philippines)
description:
Compensation: $4-5/hr

Type: Full-time

Schedule: 40 hours/week with availability within 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM US Hours

Tools: TenantCloud and Basic QuickBooks familiarity is a plus



Role Overview

We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Virtual Assistant to provide high-level administrative support to a busy executive. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, self-motivated, and able to perform effectively in a fast-paced virtual environment. This role requires strong communication skills, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to anticipate and respond to the executive’s needs.





Responsibilities

• Calendar management and scheduling including confirmations, reminders, follow ups, reschedules, and keeping everything organized.

• Inbox and communication support including organizing and prioritizing messages, drafting replies, following up on open items, and ensuring responses are completed.

• Travel logistics including booking flights and hotels, tracking confirmations, handling changes, and producing clean itineraries.

• Customer support through chat and
 including resolving issues quickly, documenting outcomes, and escalating when needed.

• Research properties in specific areas, build organized lead lists, and conduct outreach. 

• Personal online tasks including ordering, scheduling, coordination, research, and follow through.

• TenantCloud support including tenant and property records, rent status, leasing leads, and documentation.

• Basic QuickBooks support including simple categorization, invoices, payment tracking, pulling basic reports, and keeping everything organized.



Qualifications

• Proven experience in Virtual Assistant, Admin Support and similar roles. 

• Exceptional English communication skills (written & verbal).

• Detail oriented and highly organized. 

• Ability to work independently and stay organized under minimal supervision

• Not afraid to ask lots of questions early to hit the ground running. 

• Proactive mindset, you anticipate needs and take action

•  Proficiency with Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

• Must be available to work full-time during US business hours

• Strong understanding of confidentiality and professionalism



How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)

We do not want generic copy-paste applications. To apply, please send:



1. Your Resume (PDF preferred).



2. Loom Video (under 5 minutes): Introduce yourself and answer:

• What kind of VA work have you done most recently?

• Describe a recent situation where you had to manage multiple tasks or deadlines at the same time. How did you prioritize and what was the outcome?

• Walk us through your step-by-step process for handling a new task you’ve never done before.



3. Submit your application to: 
 - Please use the following
 subject line when submitting your application: Virtual Assistant Application – [Your Full Name] – [Resume + Loom Video]



(Only applicants who complete all 3 steps will be considered.)

title: SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT PRODUCER + VIDEO EDITOR
description:
? PART-TIME JOB POST: SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT PRODUCER + VIDEO EDITOR

(Podcast Repurposing + Sales Content + YouTube + Reels)



Part-Time | Remote (Philippines Preferred) | Long-Term Role

Must collaborate closely with our Executive VA



About the Business



We are a physician-led lifestyle medicine brand with both a clinical and coaching division. We produce high-value educational content weekly through a video podcast, membership, and seasonal challenges.



The founder creates long-form video content. Your job is to turn that content into a complete social media ecosystem AND create original sales-focused content that drives revenue.



This is not a basic VA role. This is a creative producer role for someone who understands content, hooks, branding, and short-form performance.



The #1 Goal of This Role



To make our content perform and convert.



You will:



repurpose long-form podcast episodes into short-form content



create new sales-based social media content that supports our current offers



maintain a polished brand aesthetic



ensure YouTube and podcast content looks clean and professional



Hours / Workload



5–10 hours/week



Flexible hours (work can be batched)



Must hit deadlines consistently



The founder often records 3 podcast episodes at a time, so work can be completed on a flexible schedule as long as deliverables are ready by deadline.



Weekly Responsibilities

1. Podcast Repurposing Pipeline



For each podcast episode, you will:



pull the Riverside recording or access from Google Drive



generate transcript (AI tools allowed)



create polished show notes + episode descriptions (ChatGPT allowed, must be edited)



upload transcripts + show notes into shared Google Drive folder (organized by episode)



maintain organized asset folders so our podcast producer has everything needed



2. YouTube Upload + Optimization



For each episode you will:



upload full video podcast to YouTube



write SEO-friendly title and description



add links, hashtags, tags, and formatting



create and upload a professional YouTube thumbnail in Canva



ensure content is organized properly for easy publishing



3. Short-Form Video Creation (Opus Clips Required)



You will turn long-form podcast episodes into polished short-form clips.



Responsibilities include:



upload long-form video into Opus Clips



select best clips for retention and engagement



clean captions and formatting



tighten pacing (remove awkward pauses, dead space)



add hook overlays and CTA overlays



export correctly formatted for:



Instagram Reels



 Reels



YouTube Shorts



Expected output:



5–8 polished clips per episode (minimum)



4. Social Media Sales Content Creation (Creative Brain Required)



In addition to repurposing podcasts, you will also create original sales-based content to support current offers such as:



membership enrollment



seasonal challenges



evergreen products



You will create:



reel ideas and hooks



post concepts and carousel ideas



CTA-driven content prompts



story sequences and sales story scripts



promo-style captions and call-to-action content



This requires strong marketing instincts and a creative mind.



5. Long-Form Podcast Video Editing / Cleanup



You will audit and improve the long-form podcast videos as needed.



Responsibilities include:



review podcast recordings for quality



trim awkward starts/stops



remove dead space when needed



ensure clean beginning/end and professional presentation



flag any issues for the founder (audio/video concerns)



You do NOT need to create cinematic edits — but you must ensure content looks polished and professional.



6. Brand Aesthetic + Consistency



You must maintain a clean, cohesive brand aesthetic:



consistent fonts/colors/templates



consistent tone and messaging



strong hook formatting



modern, polished look



Collaboration Requirement



You will work closely with our Executive VA to ensure:



content supports weekly/monthly sales priorities (“what are we selling this week?”)



deliverables are posted/scheduled properly



assets are stored and organized in Drive



deadlines are met for podcast producer and marketing schedule



Tools You Must Be Comfortable With



Required:



Opus Clips (or similar)



Canva (thumbnails + overlays)



Google Drive organization



YouTube Studio



ChatGPT (for repurposing + descriptions)



Riverside or downloading long-form recordings



Preferred:



Kajabi blog posting



SEO knowledge and optimization



Meta Business Suite formatting



Required Skills



Strong English writing skills



Strong editing instincts for short-form performance



Ability to identify hooks and create engaging content



Good aesthetic + design sense



Strong organization and deadline reliability



Comfortable working independently with minimal oversight



Knowledge of health/wellness/MD coaching preferred



Important Brand Rules



No medical advice



No medical claims



No promises



Founder sign-off tone must remain consistent



Compensation



Part-time role: 5–10 hours/week

Pay based on skill level and speed.

We are open to hourly or monthly retainer.



How to Apply



Please submit:



Short introduction



Relevant experience (especially podcast repurposing and reels editing)



Tools you have used (Opus Clips, Canva, YouTube, ChatGPT)



Links to your work:



reels/shorts you edited



thumbnails you created



sales captions or content you’ve written



Your hourly rate



Weekly availability



Applications without examples will not be considered.

title: Computer Science Tutor / Final Year Project Mentor
description:
We’re looking for a Computer Science tutor/mentor to support a student completing their final year project.



Responsibilities



Help the student clarify requirements, scope, and project plan



Explain relevant CS concepts, algorithms, system design, and trade-offs



Review code the student has written and provide feedback (structure, bugs, performance)



Support debugging and testing (pair-programming style, screen-share)



Review documentation and presentation materials for clarity



Help the student prepare for demo/viva by asking practice questions



Requirements



Strong CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, OOP)



Ability to read and review code in [Python/Java/JavaScript/etc.]



Experience with [web/mobile/ML/data/embedded] projects (depending on topic)



Clear communicator and patient teacher



Comfortable with Zoo
et and async feedback

title: Executive Assistant to CEO, multi-location Spa in USA
description:
**Location:** Remote www.cloud9.spa

**Employment Type:** Full-Time

Must be dedicated, cannot accept other side jobs or projects, otherwise, please do not apply.



About Us:

We are a rapidly growing chain of family-friendly spas committed to exceptional client experience, employee development, and operational excellence. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a highly experienced and proactive HR Specialist & Executive Assistant to the CEO to support high-level strategic initiatives and drive team success across our multi-location business.



---



### Key Responsibilities



**HR & Team Development**



* Assist the CEO in developing and implementing a manager training program tailored for the spa industry.

* Conduct bi-monthly one-on-one meetings with front desk staff and managers to promote professional growth and address operational concerns.

* Review and enhance career development tracks for receptionists and managers.

* Lead quarterly performance reviews for all front desk staff and managers.

* Collaborate in project performance reviews, including tracking milestones and outcomes.



**Strategic Communications & Project Management**



* Communicate major project announcements, updates, and evaluations on behalf of the CEO.

* Support project execution and help ensure follow-through and accountability across departments.

* Manage and enhance online reputation by reviewing customer feedback, drafting responses, and proposing service resolutions.



**Executive Support**



* Manage the CEO’s calendar, travel, and strategic planning needs.

* Conduct business research to support decision-making and strategic initiatives.

* Assist in evaluating completed projects, including effectiveness, team performance, and client impact.

* Provide assistance on special projects and operational improvements across the organization.



---



### Qualifications



* 5–10 years of HR experience in an American business environment, preferably in multi-location operations.

* Proven experience in developing managers, leading teams, and implementing performance management systems.

* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; must be articulate, persuasive, and detail-oriented.

* Strong project management and organizational abilities.

* Demonstrated success in managing by objectives and driving results.

* High level of discretion, emotional intelligence, and ability to handle confidential information.

* Background in wellness, hospitality, or service-based industries is a plus.



---



What We Offer



* Opportunity to work closely with executive leadership

* Collaborative and mission-driven team environment

* Growth potential in a fast-scaling company



---



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, a self intro video, and some project summaries demonstrating your ability to communicate effectively and manage complex initiatives.

title: CRO Specialist
description:
About LUCYD:

At LUCYD, we’re transforming the world of digital advertising with a focus on wellness, sustainability, and social responsibility. We specialize in compliant advertising for CBD, cannabis, and DTC wellness brands, and we're not just selling products—we're creating positive impact through Conscious Compounds™.



We’re looking for a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist, with a specific focus on landing pages, to join our marketing team. Your main role will be to design, optimize, and analyze landing pages that drive paid social ad performance and increase eCommerce conversions. Add the word "expedition" on your subject line to let us know you read the whole post.



Responsibilities:

Lead Landing Page Strategy: Own the landing page process—from wireframing to writing compelling copy and gathering visual assets

Collaborate with Designers & Developers: Ensure every page is visually stunning and built for high conversion

A/B Testing & Performance Analysis: Analyze data to continuously test and refine landing pages

Funnel Optimization: Audit the full eCommerce funnel and recommend improvements to boost performance



You MUST have the following qualifications:

3+ years of experience in CRO with focus on landing pages & eCommerce funnels

Proficient in Shopify, wireframing tools, and platforms like Unbounce, Leadpages, or similar

Strong analytical skills using Google Analytics, Hotjar, or similar tools

Excellent English communication skills (C1 Advanced level or Native)

Highly collaborative and detail-oriented

Must be available to work Eastern Time (EST/EDT) hours

title: Junior Creative Strategist For eCom Jewelry Brand
description:
Join the team building the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life. 



We’re looking for people who take ownership, move fast, and want their work to actually mean something.



At BALANZI, you’ll help build the #1 destination for Cuban Links by turning ideas into execution; supporting the systems, creatives, and processes that power our growth. 



Start here (required): 
 



Watch this short video from the founders about BALANZI, our mission, and how we work. 



Role Overview 



- Role: Creative Executor (Junior) 

- Location: Fully remote

- Schedule: You pick the hours where you perform best

- Compensation: Determined after trial



We’re looking for a Creative Executor who owns the full day-to-day flow of creative execution, from raw footage intake to editor-ready assets.



You’ll work closely with one of our co-founders to break down footage, organize assets, prepare editor requests, manage revisions, and keep creative production moving fast and clean.



This is an execution-first role by design. You learn strategy by doing the work, spotting patterns, and understanding what actually performs, not by sitting on the sidelines.



If you consistently execute with speed, attention to detail, and sound judgment, this role is the foundation for growing into a 

Creative Strategist position.



Who This Is Really For



- You thrive in high standards

- You take REAL ownership 

- You learn fast and figure things out

- You perform best when the stakes are real 

- You care about building something meaningful 

- You’re willing to get your hands dirty to move the mission forward



Our Core Values



The right person for this role will connect deeply with our values, live them daily, and understand why they’re essential for building something great.



1. No Compromises – You never compromise on anything, from product to customer experience.

2. Ultimate Perseverance – You don’t stop. The challenge doesn’t matter; there’s always a solution to a problem. 

3. Extreme Ownership – You take full ownership. You care about the details and deliver work you’re proud to put your name on.



If these values don’t feel like a natural fit, please do not apply. 



Main Responsibilities: 



- Own the full intake, review, and breakdown of all raw creative assets across customers, creators, partners, and internal shoots, ensuring no footage is wasted 



- Break down every raw file into deployable components including hooks, talking heads, B-roll, and standalone raw ads, with full timestamping and context tagging 



- Maintain and update shared B-roll, hooks, and talking-head banks, ensuring assets are categorized by format, intent, tone, and use case 



- Assign the best-fit assets to scripts and angles provided by the Creative Strategist, flagging gaps where new footage is required 



- Act as the single point of contact for editors by preparing precise editor requests with timestamps, clip order, notes, and clear do/don’t rules 



- Manage first-pass quality control on all edited assets, blocking anything that creates doubt, feels salesy, or breaks BALANZI’s calm, confident tone 



- Organize and maintain a clean creative asset library so footage is reusable across ads, cutdowns, and future campaigns without reshoots 



- Ensure editors are never blocked, creative velocity stays high, and strategy can be executed without friction or delays 



- Offload execution-heavy creative work from the founders and strategist so they can focus on direction, growth, and decision-making  



Prior Experience / Skills



- No experience required

- We're hiring for potential, not experience

- Your performance during the trial is all that matters



About Us 



BALANZI exists to build the world’s best Cuban Link chain for everyday life - so that men can move through life feeling confident, without ever needing to take off their chain or change who they are.



Founded in 2020, we didn’t start with a big mission. We chased money, sold products we didn’t believe in, and eventually realized we hated what we were building. So we scrapped everything and kept only one thing: Cuban Links - the only product our customers truly loved.



Over the last 12 months, we’ve rebuilt BALANZI from the ground up: redesigned products, raised our quality standards, refined our positioning, and committed fully to becoming the #1 destination for Cuban Links.



Today, we’re a small, passionate team focused on excellence, long-term thinking, and building a brand we’re truly proud of; never compromising on product, customer experience, or our team.



Why Work For BALANZI? 



- Your work has real impact, and it will directly shape BALANZI and its future

- You work directly with the founders, not buried under layers of management

- You’ll have real ownership, autonomy, and the ability to move the needle fast

- You’ll grow faster here than in any traditional environment 

- You’ll join a team with high standards, no bureaucracy, and a clear mission we believe in



If this gets you fired up, then click below and apply now.

title: Closer/SDR Appt Setter for Ebay Coaching Academy
description:
This role is for ecommerce academy that offers high ticket coaching programs for beginners to exceed on selling on ebay or amazon. PLEASE READ THE JOB POST TILL THE END



This position is becoming a sales phone dialer for the company where you will be calling people who opted in to our free materials and booking them into calls where we will close them into high ticket programs. As well as following up with previous clients to cross sell them into more packages. 



If you do not fit these requirements below please do not bother applying.

Requirements:

-Previous sales and calling experience

-Collected or contributed at least $100k into company sales

-No accent

-Work USA hours 10am-7pm EST

-Have at least 3 sales call recordings to send

-Disciplined and can dial at least 100 to 200 leads a day

-Experience with gohighlevel, 
 and ecommerce preferred



Roles:

-Calling lead opt ins within 5 minutes of opt in and booking them into calls

- Following and calling leads who did not pickup the first time for 7 consecutive days

-Reaching out to already booked calls a few hours before appointment to make sure they will show up, hype for the call and presold for the closers.

-Calling and sending consecutive follow up SMS's for leads that joined the call but did not close and had a few objections

-Following up leads that no showed or canceled calls. Rebooking them into new days

-Updating our CRM system (Gohighlevel) and maintaining organized lead tracking

-Communicating clearly with the sales and marketing team to ensure smooth handoffs

- Updating google sheets with lead info and tracking



Salary is $2k to $5k/month



Please send a message with a intro video of your previous experience and sales call recordings! If you do not have sales call recordings send a mock roleplay call for you dialing a lead who opted into a free ebay training and your goal is to do a progress check, discover pain points, financial qualify and set them into a longer call with manager on how we can help them in detail.



If you do not send these in the initial message you will get ignored. This is a high paying job with lots of rewards and we are hiring urgently.

title: Senior GoHighLevel Architect (Insurance & Consulting Funnels) - US Time Zone
description:
THE ROLE:

We are a US-based group launching three distinct brands (Insurance Agency, Lead Gen, and B2B Consulting). We need a GoHighLevel Architect to build our marketing "engine." This is a high-level role responsible for designing websites, building complex automation workflows, and ensuring our paid ads (FB/Google) sync perfectly with our CRM.



We need an Insurance Marketing Expert who understands the difference between a "warm transfer" and a "web lead" and knows how to build a GHL system that helps our team strike while the iron is hot.



THE PROJECTS

  
 & Ash Mill Insurance: High-volume insurance funnels (Paid Ads -> Landing Page -> SMS Nurture).

  - Bind Bros LLC: A B2B consulting funnel selling "Business-in-a-Box" setups. You will build Master Snapshots of our insurance funnels that we can "one-click" deploy for consulting clients using Custom Values and automated onboarding.



WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  - Architecture & Productization: Set up 3 Sub-Accounts and build "template-ready" Snapshots. You must ensure logos, links, and phone numbers update automatically via Custom Values when we deploy a new client.

  - Funnel & Automation Mastery: Build high-converting, premium-looking landing pages (CSS knowledge is a plus). Configure complex "Speed-to-Lead" workflows (Missed Call Text Back, Fast-Five Nurtures).

  - Technical Stack: Handle A2P 10DLC registration (Critical), configure Power Dialers, and integrate Stripe for automated service delivery.

  - Ad Tracking: Connect
 Lead Forms and Google Conversion API (CAPI) to ensure 1:1 attribution for our ad spend.



REQUIREMENTS (MUST HAVE):

  - 3+ Years Deep GHL Experience: You have built Snapshots from scratch and mastered the Workflow builder.

  - Insurance Industry Expertise: You speak the language (Quotes, Bind, Dec Pages, X-Dates).

  - Compliance & Tracking: Proven success with A2P 10DLC registration and UTM/CAPI ad attribution.

  - SaaS/Consulting Logic: You understand the B2B user journey, from booking an appointment to automated contract delivery.



BENEFITS AND PAY:

- Salary: 100,000 PHP - 120,000 PHP / Month (Depending on experience).

- Schedule: Full-Time, US Business Hours (EST).

- Long-term contract or position.



HOW TO APPLY

To be considered, submit your Portfolio/CV and a link to short video (Loom or similar, 3-5 minutes)



In your video, please include:

  - Show us the "Under the Hood" logic of a complex Insurance Funnel or Workflow you built.

  - Explain your "X-Date" strategy: How do you automate a re-engagement workflow for a prospect whose policy expires in 6 months?

  - Explain your "Friction" strategy: How do you capture a phone number before asking deep underwriting questions (like VINs)? Mention if you have used Canopy Connect.



In the text of your application, please provide:

  - What is one "hidden" reason A2P 10DLC Brand Registration gets rejected for insurance agencies, and how do you prevent it?

- Put the word 'ARCHITECT' at the very top of your application so I know you read this entire post.

title: YouTube Video Editor – Documentary / Silent Vlog Style (Long-Term)
description:
Position: YouTube Video Editor

Type: Long-term, remote

Platform: OnlineJobs.ph

Start: Immediate (trial first, then ongoing)



About the Project



I’m launching a YouTube channel called Life of a DJ/Promoter — a documentary-style series that captures the real day-to-day life behind electronic music and rave culture.



The channel focuses on:

- process over performance

- documentation over narration

- real 
nts, not hype

- There is little to no talking on camera (mostly background noise)

- The story is told through editing, pacing, visuals, sound design, and subtitles.



This is not influencer content. It’s a grounded, cinematic, process-driven documentary series.



What You’ll Be Editing

Each episode includes:



1 long-form YouTube video (8–15 minutes)



3–7 vertical Shorts (YouTube Shorts / IG Reels / TikTok)



Subtitles (clean, intentional, well-paced) - I will provide the copy for each video for you to edit



Light music and sound design - I will send you tracks



Occasional b-roll (from provided assets or stock)



Your Responsibilities:

- Edit documentary-style YouTube videos

- Shape story without voice-over

- Select strong 
nts from raw footage

- Guide me in shooting better raw footage as needed 



Add subtitles that enhance the narrative



- Create Shorts from long-form edits

- Maintain a consistent visual and pacing style

- Deliver organized project files and exports



What I’m Looking For:

- Strong sense of storytelling and pacing

- Experience editing YouTube videos (documentary, vlog, or cinematic style)

- Excellent English comprehension (for subtitles)

- Comfortable editing without heavy narration

- Reliable, timely, organized, and detail-oriented



Proficient in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve



Nice to have (not required):

- Experience with silent vlogs

- Familiarity with music, nightlife, or creative culture

- Experience using AI tools for captions, transcripts, or rough cuts



Work Structure & Output:

Phase 1 – Initial Batch

Edit 5 full episodes to build a content buffer



Timeline: 2–4 weeks (quality > speed)

Phase 2 – Ongoing

Edit 1–2 episodes per week



Maintain a rolling content buffer



Long-term collaboration if it’s a good fit



Compensation



Per episode: $150–$220 USD (roughly 600+ a month)

(Includes long-form video + 3–7 Shorts)



or



Monthly retainer: $600–$1,800 USD

(Depending on weekly output)



A paid test project ($40–$60) is required before final selection.



How to Apply



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Links to 2–3 relevant editing samples



Your preferred rate (per episode or monthly)



Your weekly availability



Applicants without samples will not be considered

title: Grant Writer
description:
Grant Writer – Job Description

Position Overview

We are seeking a passionate, detail-oriented, and mission-driven Grant Writer to join our small but growing nonprofit team. The Grant Writer will play a pivotal role in building the organization’s financial sustainability by researching and securing funding opportunities from foundations, corporations, and government agencies.



The ideal candidate has strong writing and analytical skills, with a preference for those who have an interest in community-based organizations, K–12 education, higher education, and workforce development.



This is a part-time or contract position (10–15 hours per week) with the potential to expand as the organization grows.

Key Responsibilities

• Grant Research & Prospecting

• Identify grant opportunities that align with the organization’s mission and programs.

• Maintain and update a calendar of deadlines for applications and reporting.

• Proposal Development

• Write clear, persuasive, and mission-aligned proposals, letters of inquiry, and concept papers.

• Develop budgets and financial narratives in collaboration with leadership.

• Tailor applications to meet the specific guidelines and priorities of each funder.

• Grant Management & Reporting

• Track grant submissions, awards, and reporting requirements.

• Draft and submit interim and final reports in a timely manner.

• Ensure compliance with all grant and funder requirements.

• Relationship Building

• Support leadership in cultivating and maintaining strong relationships with foundation officers and donors.

• Prepare briefing materials for meetings with current and prospective funders.

Qualifications

• Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling skills with keen attention to detail.

• Ability to synthesize complex information into compelling narratives.

• Familiarity with nonprofit program design and budget development.

• Strong organizational and time management skills; able to manage multiple deadlines.

• Prior experience in grant writing or fundraising (professional, internship, or volunteer).

• Passion for the mission and a willingness to grow with a small nonprofit.

Additional Information

Reports To: Executive Director/Board Chair

Type: Part-time (10–15 hours per week, with potential for growth as funding increases).

Location: Remote

title: HEAD OF OPERATIONS  - Build & Run EU Talent Recruitment Marketplace
description:
We are building a new self-service recruitment platform that connects high-quality international talent (Philippines, LATAM, Eastern Europe) with companies in Germany and Europe.



We are looking for a hands-on, highly organized Head of Operations (Founding Role) who can fully own and run this project end-to-end. The founder’s involvement should be minimal (“hands-off”).



BIG BONUS: You have worked at a remote staffing / recruiting company similar to 
 / Support Shepherd (or a comparable recruitment agency) and understand how to build trust with European clients while maintaining high candidate quality.







ABOUT THE MISSION (WIN-WIN)

Our goal is to create a true win-win:

 • A win for talented people from the Philippines and other regions: access to stable, full-time EU jobs

 • A win for EU companies: access to reliable, high-quality talent in a simple and transparent way

We do not want to position this as “cheap labor.” We focus on quality, reliability, and trust.







WHAT YOU WILL FULLY OWN (END-TO-END)

 1. BUILD THE PRE-LAUNCH TALENT POOL (SUPPLY)



 • Build and manage a curated talent pool across multiple categories (quality over quantity)

 • Source candidates (OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn, Upwork, communities, referrals)

 • Ensure each candidate profile is complete and professional:

 • Professional photo

 • Short intro video (Loom)

 • CV + portfolio / proof of work

 • English level (tested or verified)

 • Tools/skills

 • Salary expectations (full-time / part-time)

 • Availability date

 • Organize everything cleanly in:

 • Google Sheets (main database)

 • Google Drive (photos, videos, documents)

 • Manage candidate statuses: Applied / Screened / Vetted / Approved / Ready



 2. BUILD & RUN EU CLIENT ACQUISITION (DEMAND) – BASIC BUT EFFECTIVE



 • Build lists of target EU companies (Germany/EU focus)

 • Run outbound outreach 
 + LinkedIn) in professional English

 • Qualify companies and collect hiring requirements

 • Coordinate introductions (company ? candidate)

 • Track a simple pipeline and conversion metrics



 3. DEFINE THE OPERATING SYSTEM (PROCESSES + QUALITY + TRUST)



 • Create SOPs (step-by-step processes) for:

 • sourcing and screening

 • candidate onboarding and profile preparation

 • client qualification and requirement gathering

 • matching + intro process + follow-ups

 • replacement / guarantee process (trust building)

 • Set up and manage simple tools and dashboards:

 • Notion or ClickUp (task management)

 • Google Sheets (KPIs and reporting)

 • Provide a short weekly report: KPIs, wins, blockers, next steps



 4. PREPARE PLATFORM LAUNCH (HANDOVER TO THE WEB APP)



 • Prepare candidate data so it can later be imported into the platform (Bubble)

 • Coordinate with the developer when needed (requirements, QA, testing feedback)

 • Ensure we launch with strong trust and quality from day one



 5. BUILD AND MANAGE A SMALL REMOTE TEAM (IF NEEDED)



 • Hire and manage 1–2 sourcers and/or a coordinator as needed

 • Train them using SOPs and quality standards

Goal: a lean operation that runs without daily founder involvement.







ROLE CATEGORIES (EXAMPLES)

We focus on roles that European companies can manage in English:

 • Amazon & Marketplace (PPC, listing, account management)

 • E-commerce Operations (Shopify ops, catalog, CX)

 • Performance Marketing (Google/YouTube, SEO,
/CRM)

 • Creative (video editing, design, Amazon creatives)

 • AI & Automation (Make/Zapier, AI agents, workflows)

 • Web Dev / UX/UI / QA

 • Sales/Lead Gen, Ops/EA, Data/BI, Finance Ops







REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

 • Strong experience in recruitment / talent sourcing / HR operations / staffing

 • Proven ability to deliver quality candidates (not mass recruiting)

 • Excellent English communication (written + spoken)

 • Very organized, process-driven, and reliable

 • Strong judgment: you can evaluate real skill and professionalism

 • Able to work independently and take full ownership



BONUS



 • Experience at 
 / Support Shepherd or similar remote staffing/recruiting agency

 • Experience working with European clients and understanding EU expectations

 • Experience building SOPs, hiring workflows, and managing small remote teams







SUCCESS METRICS (CLEAR EXPECTATIONS)



First 30 days:

 • Operating system in place (SOPs + dashboards + process)

 • 5–7 priority categories started

 • 100+ vetted candidates in the database

 • EU outreach started (target list + messaging + pipeline)



First 60 days:

 • 200–300 vetted candidates across priority categories

 • Regular company interest and introductions happening

 • Trust / replacement process defined



First 90 days:

 • Operation runs with minimal founder involvement

 • Consistent placement 
ntum (goal: building toward 2–3 hires per week)

 • A small team can support the process if needed



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)

Please include ALL of the following:

 1. Short introduction + relevant experience

 2. Any experience in remote staffing / recruitment agencies (especially Somewhere/Support Shepherd-like)

 3. Your exact 30-day plan (step-by-step):

 • how you will source candidates

 • how you will vet and onboard them

 • how you will approach Germany/EU company acquisition

 4. Realistic weekly numbers:

 • how many vetted candidates you can deliver per week

 • how many EU companies you can outreach per week

 5. Examples of SOPs, systems, or dashboards you built (if available)



Applications without a clear 30-day plan will not be considered.



If this sounds like a strong fit, I’d love to hear your plan and how you would run this operation end-to-end



Thank You :)!!

title: Content Moderation Specialist
description:
Content Moderation Specialist - Live Streaming Platforms



We're looking for Content Moderation Specialists to support live streaming platforms with chat moderation and broadcast monitoring.



___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________



WHAT YOU'LL DO:



- Moderate chat interactions on live broadcasts

- Monitor broadcast quality and content compliance

- Enforce community guidelines

- Handle viewer reports and concerns

- Support technical stream operations

- Document issues and maintain standards



You work behind the scenes - NOT on camera. This is a support and moderation role for gaming, esports, and professional streaming platforms.



REQUIREMENTS:



Must have:

- Male, age 18-30 years old

- English communication skills

- Understanding of PC hardware and software

- Flexible schedule availability



Experience in streaming, moderation, or technical support is not required, but is desirable.



Your computer setup:

Since you'll be monitoring multiple streams and running specialized software, a decent gaming PC or modern workstation works best. Typically needs multi-core processor (6+ cores), dedicated graphics card (1060 6gb and above), 16GB memory, and stable 100+ Mbps internet. 



COMPENSATION



• Base salary + performance bonuses

• Full-time: $550-$770 USD/month

• Training: 2-3 days (paid daily)

• Probation: First 2 weeks (full pay)

• Payment: Weekly or bi-weekly, bank transfer



Flexible shifts: Morning / Day / Evening (night differential available)



TO APPLY:



Send message with:

1. Your name, age

2. Your processor (example: i5 11400 or Ryzen 5 3600)

3. Your graphics card (example: GTX 1660 or RX6000)

4. Your RAM amount (example: 16GB)

5. Internet speed (run speedtest)



Applications with complete info reviewed first!

title: Entry-Level Healthcare Virtual Assistant (full/part-time)
description:
APPLICATION PROCESS:

1.
 us your resume in PDF format only. Include all of the jobs you've worked at and the month + year. Do not leave anything off. Do not leave anything off.  You must provide an explanation of any gaps in your work history. Include the compensation you received for each job. Do not give us your hourly pay, only your annual compensation or total compensation.  If there is any gap in your resume without an explanation of the gap, you will be disqualified.



2.
 us a 60-second video of yourself answering the following question:

What are the 3 most important things that the company you work for MUST do to show you that they care about you? For example, if they don’t give me these 3 things then that means they don’t care about me. The video CANNOT EXCEED 60 seconds, or you will automatically be disqualified.



3. IMPORTANT: Please
 the above two items to 
 to follow the above instructions will result in automatic disqualifications.  Do not DM us or call us or contact us in any other way.



ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

Achieve Integrative Health is the #1 rated Acupuncture & Wellness Clinic in the United States with over 750 five star google reviews. Our Mission is to help people restore their body’s God given ability to heal itself so that they can do what they love. Our vision is to equip and inspire one million people around the world to do what they love, when they want, with whom they want. (
)



WHY JOIN US?

• You’ll Achieve your Goals = our team provides all of the resources (information, training, opportunities) you’ll need to achieve all of your Professional, Financial and Personal Goals, as long as you are willing to put in the work and deliver results.



• Peace and Joy Team = we have a phenomenal culture of care for our patients and our tea
mbers. We are very strict with our rules, policies and core values in order to protect our culture of peace and joy. We make sure tea
mbers who are not aligned with our core values exit our team so that they do not disrupt our peace and joy. Imagine being on a team where you don’t have to deal with people who talk behind your back and end up back stabbing you.



• Be Highly Rewarded as a Side Benefit = imagine being able to do your Passion everyday and make a phenomenal living as a side benefit. The average "experienced" VAs in the Philippines/Indonesia make $5-$7 USD/hr, our entry-level VAs start off making $5/hr. We have a quarterly bonus program, where some of our tea
mbers have earned $500-$1000USD per quarter, and this year 2025, because the team has performed so well, some tea
mbers were paid an 'additional' year end bonus of $2000-$3000 USD.



BENEFITS

• Competitive Total Compensation = $5-$12 USD/hr for graveyard shift only.

• Unlimited Opportunities for Growth = as long as you can generate more results for the company we will never limit your ability to grow within our company. Every tea
mber can also become a partner of the business if they desire.

• Other Benefits for qualified tea
mbers = paid-time off, premiu
dical insurance, Employee Savings Matching Program

• Work from Home = no more 2-4 hour commutes to work

• Wellness Initiatives = benefit from complimentary virtual health services from our medical providers, ensuring your well-being and your family’s well-being is always a priority.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

• Receive all inbound calls to close Leads wanting to receive treatments at our clinic

• Call,
, and use various communication forms to identify the validity and potential of the lead

• Receive all inbound calls to answer questions – fact find and qualify lead/route to appropriate tea
mber if needed

• Work with patients to ensure they are satisfied with the services provided

• Encourage happy patients to send us their success stories

• Share patient success stories during daily company meeting

• Implement our CARE system to follow-up with our patients to provide 5 star service

• Check-in and checkout patients

• Verify Insurance Benefits

• Other additional tasks may be added based on your strengths…



CHARACTER REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS

• You must truly have a caring heart and truly want to help people improve their health, if you are mainly focused on how much money you can make, we are not the team for you

• You must speak Fluent English (ie. someone on the phone can understand what you're saying w/o straining)

• You must be organized and be able to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities everyday. If you’re looking to only do one or two tasks per day, we are the wrong team for you.

• You must be able to follow instructions exactly as written, if you don’t like reading or following instructions, we are not the right team for you

• You must have a good heart. If you like to gossip behind peoples back, please don’t apply.

• You must value Results over effort. If you like to be paid based on how many tasks you completed or how much responsibilities you have, we are not the team for you. We pay ONLY based on you meeting your KPIs, metrics, quotas.

• You must sleep the same schedule 7 days a week, as this is a graveyard shift, you cannot switch back to the Philippines time zone on the weekends as this destroys your health. Your Health is our priority, and if you don’t value your own health we don’t want you on our team.

• You must be honest and have integrity. If you are caught lying, you will be immediately terminated.

• You must want to EARN your pay (ie. base salary + bonuses) instead of being given a pay (ie. focused only on base salary) that you didn’t earn.



WORKSTATION REQUIREMENTS

• You must have a separate quiet room to work in. You can not have your children or anybody else in the room that you work as your screen will be displaying confidential information, no exceptions.

• There can not be any background noise in your room when you are making phone calls.

• You will be required to provide photos of your workspace

• We will also randomly ask you to show your workspace via your webcam, and if you are caught lying you will be fired immediately.



COMPUTER AND INTERNET REQUIREMENTS:

• Fast and reliable wired internet connection of not less than 100 Mbps

• Secondary and Tertiary Back up Internet of not less than 10 Mbps

• At least one Power Station Backup

• Dual Monitor

• Intel Core i3 or higher Operating System with at least 8gb RAM

• Excellent quality headset with microphone, and a working webcam



WORK SCHEDULE:

OPTION 1 > Full-time 8:00 - 18:00 (M-Th) 8:00-16:00 (F) U.S. Central Standard Time, 2-hr lunch breaks 

OPTION 2 > Part-time 7:00-13:00 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time 

OPTION 3 > Part-time 13:00-18:30 (M-F) U.S. Central Standard Time

title: Virtual Assistant – Marketing, Visibility & Executive Support
description:
Centric Business Solutions LLC is seeking a highly organized, proactive Virtual Assistant to support marketing, visibility, and executive administrative functions. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, multi-project environment, enjoys working behind the scenes to elevate a brand, and can manage competing priorities with precision.

The Virtual Assistant will play a key role in expanding Centric’s visibility through social media management, award and recognition research, speaking engagement coordination, and general executive support.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Marketing & Social Media

• Manage and schedule social media content across platforms (LinkedIn, Instagram, and others as assigned)

• Assist with content planning, captions, hashtags, and posting calendars

• Monitor engagement and flag opportunities for increased visibility

• Maintain consistency with Centric’s brand voice and messaging

________________________________________

Visibility, Awards & Recognition

• Research and identify industry awards, rankings, and recognition opportunities relevant to Centric and its founder

• Track deadlines, eligibility requirements, and submission criteria

• Assist with organizing application materials and timelines

• Maintain a visibility and awards calendar

________________________________________

Speaking Engagements & Thought Leadership

• Research speaking opportunities (conferences, panels, podcasts, webinars)

• Track calls for speakers and submission deadlines

• Assist with outreach, applications, and follow-ups

• Maintain a pipeline of speaking and media opportunities

________________________________________

Executive & Administrative Support

• Manage multiple projects simultaneously and track deliverables

• Maintain organized systems for documents, deadlines, and workflows

• Assist with scheduling, inbox support, and follow-ups as needed

• Support ad hoc administrative and operational tasks for the founder

________________________________________

Required Skills & Qualifications

• Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Operations Assistant

• Exceptional organizational and time-management skills

• Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently without dropping details

• Strong written communication skills

• Comfort working independently and taking initiative

• Tech-savvy and confident using tools such as Google Workspace, project management tools (e.g., Asana, ClickUp, Trello), and social scheduling platforms

• Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism at all times

________________________________________

Preferred (Nice-to-Have)

• Experience supporting professional services firms (accounting, consulting, legal, etc.)

• Familiarity with award submissions, PR, or brand visibility work

• Social media or content coordination experience

• Interest in entrepreneurship, finance, or business growth

________________________________________

What Success Looks Like

• Social media content is consistently posted and aligned with brand goals

• Award and speaking opportunities are proactively identified and tracked

• Deadlines are met without reminders

• Systems are organized, updated, and easy to follow

• The founder’s time is freed up to focus on high-level work

________________________________________

title: Video Content & Podcast Editor
description:
Hello! I'm Jacob, the founder of Liverpool Podcast Studios, the UK's leading production studio creating world-class podcasts and content for founders, SMEs, charities, and creators. We deliver a high volume of client work every week and we do it through clear systems, consistent standards, and a calm, professional well established workflow. 



We're currently a small team of just 3, and we're now looking for the right person with the right values and skillset to join our growing team and work in an environment where you'll do the best work in your career! 



This role is ideal for someone who likes structure and consistency, communicates well, and wants the stability of working with one organised production company, not juggling lots of individual clients.



A personal note fro
, I'm looking for somebody who is the perfect fit, so please only apply if you think this role was absolutely made for you! 



**Important note**

Attention to detail is highly important to us, and so the first step of the application process is ensuring you have fully read the entire job description and followed all instructions clearly. We respect your time and we ask you do the same, so any mass applications will be disregarded.



What you’ll be doing

 • Editing multi-camera podcast and content sessions in Final Cut Pro

 • Processing projects through a repeatable workflow: file organisation, assembly

 • Colour correction / grading to a consistent standard

 • Audio mixing and repair when needed (clean-up, levelling, improving clarity for spoken-word)

 • Creating deliverables including:

 • full-length episodes (video + audio versions)

 • short-form clips for social

 • occasional promos, trailers, and format variations depending on the client

 • Following SOPs closely and helping improve them over time (we're always looking to get 1?tter every day!)



Requirements:

 • You take pride in your work, and desire to be the best at what you do!

 • Excellent proficiency in English and the ability to communicate clearly and confidently 

 • Strong proficiency in Final Cut Pro (we will provide you with a licensed version)

 • A keen ear for audio and the ability to adjust processing tools such as EQ, compression and noise reduction tools

 • Highly reliable and consistent

 • Systems-minded: you follow processes accurately and communicate clearly when something changes

 • Great attention to detail and excellent time management

 • Comfortable working at pace across a variety of client content



Required setup

 • Apple Silicon computer (M1 or newer)

 • 16GB RAM minimum

 • 2TB of dedicated SSD storage

 • Stable high-speed internet



Bonus skills (nice to have)

 • Motion graphics and animation

 • Editing non-podcast formats (YouTube videos, VSLs, scripted content)

 • Graphic design



?



Schedule



We will fully train and onboard you to ensure you are set up for success within the team. The training period will be during UK time Monday-Friday 9am-6pm but when you are fully in role we will be fully flexible with your work days/times, as long as deadlines are met and there is some overlap for communication purposes.



How to apply



We only review applications that follow the instructions below exactly.



1)
/Application subject line must include the secret word: 'spider' so we know you have read this far!



2) Include your portfolio link 

The best way to show me your skill and attention to detail is to show me your best work.



3) Answer these questions clearly:

- What makes you different from the other applicants applying for this position?

- Outline your experience and how you meet the listed requirements above

- Confirm you meet the technical setup requirements listed above, and please send us a screenshot of your internet speeds

- Confirm what hours we can expect you to be available to work

- I want to support you in doing the best work of your career here with us. What are your professional goals/aspirations?



4) Optional (but gives you a massive advantage):

Send a 1 to 3 minute video introduction answering the four questions above. Applicants who send a video introduction will be prioritised in the shortlist.

Tell me a little bit about yourself personally! We will be working in a small team together so it's important to me to know a little more about you! :-) 



If this role is perfect for you, I can't wait to meet you soon!

title: New Jersey Contract, Offer & Compliance Support Specialist
description:
We are seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Real Estate Contract Admin to support offer preparation and contract execution for a New Jersey real estate agent.



This is a process-driven, checklist-based role. You will be trained on our exact systems and expectations. Success in this role depends on your ability to follow procedures carefully, ask questions when information is missing, and ensure all documents are accurate before they are sent.



This role does not require making judgment calls or negotiating terms. Accuracy, organization, and consistency are critical.



Each file includes the following:

Prepare buyer or seller offer documents in Dotloop or zipForms

Complete the required Contract Send Checklist

Send offers or counteroffers for signature via DocuSign or Dotloop

Monitor signatures and confirm full execution

Circulate fully signed documents to all required parties

Send a professional
 to the other agent once offers are fully executed

Upload fully signed documents into Dotloop

Update CRM contact records as needed



Required Skills & Experience



Experience assisting with real estate contracts or transaction documents

Familiarity with Dotloop, zipForms, and DocuSign

Strong attention to detail

Ability to follow checklists and written SOPs

Professional written English for
 communication

Willingness to escalate questions instead of guessing



Important Role Expectations



All contracts must be reviewed using the provided checklist before sending

No documents may be sent without checklist completion

Questions must be escalated — guessing is not permitted

This role focuses on execution



Hours & Availability

1:00 PM – 8:00 PM availability - on demand 

On-demand, based on offer activity

Turnaround expectations will be communicated per file



Real Estate Contract Preparation (Dotloop / zipForms)

Ability to prepare buyer and seller offers using Dotloop or zipForms, complete required fields accurately, attach correct addenda, and follow a checklist before sending for signature.



Document Execution & Circulation (DocuSign)

Experience sending contracts for signature, monitoring execution, downloading fully signed documents, and circulating executed contracts to all required parties via professional
.



 Attention to Detail & Checklist Compliance

Proven ability to follow written SOPs and checklists exactly, catch missing information, avoid errors, and escalate questions instead of guessing.



Compensation

Per file

Training provided during onboarding
