title: Credit & Capital Strategist (Remote / PST Timezone)
description:
Role Overview

This role is NOT just about fund administration. It is a strategic position designed to turn our capital operations into a "Profit Center." Your mission is to source capital at the best terms, manage credit with precision, and optimize every dollar spent to generate tangible returns. Especially as we expand into the US market, you will focus on building US credit profiles, cost-cutting, and preparing the company's credit health for global financing.



1. Core Responsibilities



US Market Credit Expansion (New Focus)



* Establish and build US Business and Personal credit profiles from the ground up for upcoming US operations.

* Research and apply for US-based corporate credit cards and financing products that offer the best rewards and float.

* Manage cross-border credit strategies to ensure seamless capital mobility between Canada and the US.



Financial Cleanup and Operational Efficiency



* Conduct a comprehensive audit of all corporate expenditures to identify and eliminate redundant subscriptions, overcharged services, and unnecessary costs.

* Develop a strategic tax payment and cash allocation plan to prioritize essential obligations while maintaining business continuity.

* Research and identify alternative or creative financing options (non-traditional lenders or asset-based lending) that are less dependent on immediate credit scores.

* Implement a strict cost-cutting roadmap to improve the company's debt-to-income ratio.



Debt Financing and Capital Sourcing



* Identify optimal lending products (Mortgages, Business Loans, Construction Loans) through various channels including banks and private lenders in both Canada and the US.

* Open and manage Line of Credit (LOC) limits to secure emergency funds and short-term liquidity.

* Lead negotiations with financial institutions to secure the best Term Sheets (Interest Rates, LTV, Amortization periods).



Credit Engineering and Score Management



* Execute a step-by-step credit repair strategy, including disputing inaccuracies on credit reports and managing debt levels to lower utilization.

* Constantly monitor Personal and Business credit scores (FICO), managing them to hit target levels of 780 or higher.

* Detect utilization spikes in real-time and execute immediate actions (e.g., prepayments, splitting charges) to protect credit scores.



Spend Optimization and Rewards



* Reallocate spend to cards with the highest accrual rates based on spending categories like Ads, Travel, and Materials.

* Strategically align credit card Closing Dates to delay cash outflows as long as possible, securing up to 45 to 55 days of float.

* Design the optimal card portfolio to maintain hotel ? airline status and other tangible business benefits.



Cash Flow and Treasury Management



* Forecast cash inflows and outflows for the next 3 to 6 months to prevent and report potential shortages.

* Monitor exchange rates for multi-currency transfers (KRW, USD, CAD, JPY) to capture optimal conversion timing.



2. Reporting and Governance



* Reports directly to the CEO for capital execution and optimization.

* Operates within Finance-approved policies, limits, and internal controls.



3. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



* Maintain credit score (CA/US) of 780 or above.

* Successful establishment of US credit lines within the first 6 months.

* Detect and eliminate at least 10% of unnecessary operational waste.

* Achieve 100 percent monthly and weekly cash visibility accuracy.



4. Key Requirements



* 3 to 5 plus years of experience in capital operations, credit management, or banking-adjacent roles.

* Experience or strong understanding of US Credit Systems (FICO, SSN/ITIN-based credit building) is a huge plus.

* Advanced Excel and Google Sheets skills (cash modeling, utilization tracking).

* Strong negotiation skills with banks and lenders.



5. Confidentiality



* This role handles highly sensitive financial, credit, and banking information.

* Strict confidentiality and integrity are required at all times.



Application Instructions

Please submit your resume along with a brief cover letter explaining:



1. Your experience with credit repair or building credit profiles (especially in the US/Canada).

2. An example of how you successfully reduced operational costs or optimized cash flow.

3. Your proficiency level with Excel/Google Sheets.

4. Confirmation that you are available to work during PST business hours.

title: Medical Virtual Assistant
description:
Medical Virtual Assistant (Remote, 20 hrs/week) Pharmacy Order Coordinator

Position Summary



We are hiring a Remote Medical Virtual Assistant to support clinical operations, with a primary focus on placing and tracking pharmacy orders. You will work closely with providers and the internal team to ensure prescriptions, compounded medications, and related orders are submitted correctly, followed through to completion, and documented in the EMR.



This is a part time role, 20 hours per week to start, and must align with Eastern Time business hours.



Key Responsibilities



Place pharmacy orders accurately based on provider direction and established protocols



Coordinate with partner pharmacies on order status, clarification requests, refills, and shipping updates



Track orders from submission through delivery and resolution using internal trackers



Maintain clean documentation in the EMR and ensure all order related notes are complete



Verify patient demographics and required intake items needed for pharmacy processing



Escalate time sensitive issues to the appropriate tea
mber promptly



Support light administrative tasks as needed depending on workload



Required Qualifications



Licensed Physician (MD/DO) or Licensed Pharmacist (PharmD or equivalent) with relevant degrees and ability to verify licensure



Experience with medication ordering workflows (pharmacy coordination, refills, compounded orders, prior authorization support, or similar)



Experience using EMRs (Cerbo experience is a bonus)



Fluent in English with strong written communication



Able to work reliably on Eastern Time and meet turnaround expectations



Detail oriented, organized, and comfortable following SOPs precisely



Preferred Qualifications



Experience with compounded medications, peptides, and hormone therapy related pharmacy workflows



Experience in functional medicine or cash pay clinic environments



Familiarity with HIPAA compliant documentation and communication



Schedule and Hours



Remote



20 hours per week to start



Availability required during Eastern Time business hours (consistent blocks strongly preferred)



What Success Looks Like



Orders are placed correctly the first time with minimal back and forth



Pharmacies receive fast responses and patients receive medications on time



EMR documentation is complete, clear, and easy to audit



Providers feel unblocked and patient experience improves



How to Apply



Please submit:



Resume or CV



Proof of licensure and degrees (MD/DO or Pharmacist)



Brief summary of relevant pharmacy ordering experience



EMR experience (Cerbo if applicable)



Weekly availability in Eastern Time

title: Marketing & Fractional CMO Agreement
description:
Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) – Full-Service Marketing

Role Overview



The Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) is responsible for developing and executing an integrated marketing strategy that drives sustainable patient growth, brand visibility, and long-term market positioning for the practice. This role goes beyond individual marketing tactics and provides strategic leadership across brand, website, advertising, reputation management, and digital visibility.



Rather than a piecemeal or à la carte approach, the Fractional CMO oversees a cohesive, full-service marketing ecosystem, ensuring that all components work together to produce measurable results.



This role provides access to a full marketing team—including strategy, design, execution, and technology—at a fraction of the cost of hiring an internal marketing department.



Core Responsibilities

Marketing Strategy & Leadership



Develop and manage a comprehensive, integrated marketing strategy aligned with practice growth goals



Serve as the strategic marketing lead and advisor to practice leadership



Ensure consistency across brand messaging, visuals, and patient experience



Identify growth opportunities tied to market conditions, competition, and expansion plans



Brand & Website Oversight



Lead website strategy, structure, messaging, and conversion optimization



Ensure the website supports visibility, credibility, and patient acquisition—not just aesthetics



Align brand identity across website, digital platforms, and patient touchpoints



Digital Visibility & Patient Acquisition



Oversee SEO, local search visibility, and online presence



Manage paid advertising strategies (Google, social, or other channels as appropriate)



Implement systems to consistently attract and convert new patients



Monitor and optimize campaigns based on performance and ROI



Reputation & Review Management



Develop and oversee review generation and reputation strategies



Ensure consistent patient feedback collection and online credibility growth



Protect and enhance the practice’s digital reputation



Execution & Team Management



Coordinate strategy, design, implementation, and technology through a dedicated marketing team



Ensure all initiatives are executed on time, on brand, and aligned with goals



Remove the burden of managing multiple vendors or internal hires



Measurement & Performance Tracking



Track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as:



New patient acquisition



Cost per lead



Conversion rates



Online visibility and engagement



Provide clear reporting and insights to leadership



Continuously refine strategy based on results



Scalable support aligned with practice growth stages



Expected Outcomes



Increased online visibility and market presence



Consistent flow of qualified new patients



Stronger brand positioning ahead of practice expansion or relocation



Timing & Strategic Importance



This role is especially critical during periods of transition or growth, such as a relocation or expansion. Addressing visibility and brand positioning early prevents lost 
ntum and avoids the challenge of playing catch-up later.



While a website alone establishes a foundation, the Fractional CMO model accelerates results by activating all growth levers simultaneously.

?

?



Nice to Have (Not Required)

?



Work Details

 • Type: This position I am looking for someone who wants stable work. You must be willing to take initiative and responsibility for your work. 

 • Hours: Flexible

 • Pay: Competitive (based on experience)



Please include:

?



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To avoid spam applications, please start your application with the word “TRACKING” and briefly explain:

Must use 15 apply points.

title: Creative Specialist for Dropshipping business (AI focused)
description:
We are looking for a Creative Specialist with proven experience in dropshipping businesses or performance-driven e-commerce brands. Someone who understands what sells, creates scroll-stopping creatives, and knows how to leverage AI tools to test and scale fast.



Responsibilities

-Create high-converting ad creatives (video & image) for social media platforms (Meta, TikTok, Google)

-Develop and optimize creatives specifically for dropshipping products

-Use AI tools to generate concepts, scripts, visuals, and variations

-Research and apply strong hooks, angles, UGC styles, and storytelling

-A/B test creatives and optimize based on performance data

-Move fast from concept ? creation ? launch



Requirements:

-Proven experience creating creatives for dropshipping or e-commerce brands

-Strong understanding of direct-response marketing

-Experience with AI tools such as:

ChatGPT (scripts, hooks, ideation)

Higgsfield or similar AI video tools

Claude or Gemini (copywriting & creative ideation)

-Experience with video editing tools (e.g. CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar)

-Creative mindset with a performance-first approach

-Independent, fast, and results-oriented



Nice to Have:

-Experience with UGC-style creatives

-Familiarity with Meta Ads 

-Experience scaling winning creatives

-Strong English communication skills



What We Offer:

-Collaboration with a fast-growing dropshipping business

-High level of creative freedom

-Competitive compensation (freelance / part-time / full-time)

-Long-term cooperation for the right candidate

-Access to and experimentation with the latest AI tools & trends



Interested?

Please send:

-A short introduction

-Examples of previous creatives (preferably dropshipping / e-commerce)

-Your experience with AI tools

title: Video Editor for Short Form Videos
description:
Short-Form Video Editor (Raw Travel Vlogs, Shorts, Reels, TikTok)



We are looking for an experienced short-form video editor to turn long-form travel vlogs into high-retention, raw-style short videos.



This is not a beginner role. We are looking for someone who already understands short-form retention, pacing, and storytelling. Please do not apply if you do not have prior experience editing short-form content.



This is not a flashy edit role.

No music, no color grading, no heavy effects.

This role is about judgment, pacing, hooks, and storytelling.



Editing style (very important)

Our content follows the raw travel vlogger style. Think Luke Damant, Harry Jaggard, Bald and Bankrupt, Kurt Caz, and similar creators.



-No background music

-No cinematic effects

-No color grading

-No fancy editing

-Clean cuts

-Natural pacing

-Strong hooks

-Subtitles that feel human, not spammy

-Letting 
nts breathe when needed

-Think real, immersive, curiosity-driven travel 
nts.



What you will do

-Watch long-form travel videos and identify strong short-form 
nts

-Cut short videos optimized for retention

-Create clean subtitles

-Write engaging titles and short descriptions

-Stitch clips together to tell a clear micro-story

-Deliver finished, ready-to-post videos



What you will NOT do

-No social media uploading or scheduling

-No social media account management

-No social media  analytics or reporting

-This role is editing only.



Requirements

-Proven experience editing short-form content for creators

-Strong understanding of hooks, pacing, and viewer curiosity

-Ability to find 
nts without being given timestamps

-Comfortable working from long-form footage

-Fluent in English

-Reliable turnaround times

-Experience with travel or vlog content is a big plus

-High speed internet for downloading and uploading video files

-Laptop or desktop with sufficient storage space



Pay structure (per short, not hourly)

We pay per finished short, based on monthly volume ranges.

Monthly volume is agreed in advance and locked for that month.



Per month rates:

30 to 40 shorts: $8 per short

41 to 60 shorts: $7.50 per short

61 to 80 shorts: $7 per short

81 to 100 shorts: $6.50 per short



This may seem like a lot at first but once you understand our style of editing makes it easy to create a short and it's not bad.



Rates are not recalculated mid-month.

Tier can change month to month if volume changes.



Revisions

One revision included per short for timing or subtitle tweaks

Major reworks count as a new short



Paid trial (required)

Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete a paid trial:

3 to 5 shorts

Paid at full rate

No timestamps given

This helps us evaluate pacing, judgment, and storytelling.



How to apply:

My
 address: iamtylerfox at gmail


 written this way to avoid it being blocked)



Please send the following to my
: 



-A short video introduction

-Links to short-form videos you personally edited with proof of authorship

-Your experience with similar content

-Applications without examples will not be considered.



This is long-term, consistent work for the right editor.

If you understand raw storytelling, pacing, and retention, we would love to see your work.

title: Creative Strategist & Content Producer
description:
About the company

At Miraco Nutripharm, we are dedicated to advancing health & improving lives. Our goal is to relieve 1 billion people worldwide of pain & discomfort. If you know of anyone who has been worried about or suffered from any health problems, join us in making a positive impact by reducing the pain & distress others have to endure.

Job description

We're looking for a Creative Strategist & Content Producer to shape how our health & pharmaceutical brands communicate across both digital & offline channels. You'll craft effective strategies that translate scientific credibility into compelling storytelling & creative assets - helping us engage our diverse audience as we expand our presence regionally. 



The Creative Strategist & Content Producer will be the visionary link between our brand identity, compelling content creation & drive measurable performance across all key channels. This role is responsible for developing & testing high-impact creative strategies as well as producing content assets (visual, video, copy) internally, specifically designed to drive traffic, increase conversion rates, lower Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) & drive overall revenue growth for our Shopify, Shopee & Lazada stores via social media as well as paid advertising platforms.



You'll work across multiple channels & markets to plan, create & optimize content that builds awareness, strengthens partnerships & supports the new channels of the business. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys balancing creativity, analytics & brand strategy in the health supplement industry. 



Key Responsibilities:

Creative Strategy

- Platform & Channel Strategy: Craft tailored creative strategies for B2C & B2B audiences optimized for platform-specific best practices & formats that align with brand goals & regulatory requirements in each market (e.g., Meta carousel ads, vertical video for TikTok/Reels, static product carousels for Shopee/Lazada e-commerce banner ads).

- Hypothesis Generation & A/B Testing: Develop robust creative testing matrices, formulate clear hypotheses for creative elements (hooks, calls-to-action, visual styles, copy length) that drive measurable improvements in Click-Through Rate (CTR) & Conversion Rate (CVR).

- Audience Segmentation: Translate target audience data & segmentation provided by media buyers into resonant creative themes, ensuring content speaks directly to different stages of the marketing funnel (awareness, consideration, conversion).

- Competitive Analysis: Continuously keep up to date with competitors & industry trends, identifying new & successful creative formats, hooks & messaging to finetune our strategy.

In-House Content Production & Execution 

- Performance Creative Development: Lead the end-to-end creative concept development & production for all organic & paid media campaigns (Meta, TikTok, Google/YouTube, etc.) that align with brand & campaign goals, focusing on high-volume, quick-turnaround testing required for performance marketing.

- Hands-on Asset Creation: Directly produce & edit native social content & performance ads using existing assets, stock libraries & internal resources. This includes:

i. Plan platform-specific content calendars: Cover educational, promotional & corporate communications

ii. Static/Image Editing: Adapt product photography, create ad variations & design simple graphics & banner ads

iii. Video Editing: Fast-paced assembly, cutting, adding text overlays, music & effects for short-form, vertical video (UGC-style, product demos, testimonials)

- Copywriting: Develop high-converting ad copy, landing page headlines & social media captions that align with the creative strategy & brand voice, with a focus on clear value propositions & strong CTAs.

- Asset Management: Ensure all campaign assets are correctly tagged, archived & deployed across relevant channels (Shopify, Shopee, Lazada store fronts & advertising platforms).

- Testing & Optimization: apply insights & analytics to refine & optimize content effectiveness across platforms.

Performance & Reporting

- Data-Driven Insights: Work closely with the Marketing Manager to analyze creative performance reports, identifying which creative variables are driving results (or failing) across Shopify, Shopee & Lazada traffic.

- Iteration & Optimization: 

i. Develop, adapt or review content & formats to improve engagement & performance

ii. Use performance data (ROAS, CPA, CTR, CVR) to rapidly iterate on existing creative assets & inform future strategy, ensuring a continuous cycle of improvement & optimization

Storefront Integration: Integrate winning creative messages & visuals onto the respective e-commerce storefronts (product pages, banners) to ensure a cohesive customer journey.

Multi-Channel Storytelling

- Content cohesion: Ensure content is aligned where possible across digital & print media, including LinkedIn, Instagram,
, YouTube, e-commerce platforms, brochures & trade materials.

- Tailor content: To achieve relevance & effectiveness across different stages of the audience journey — from brand awareness & education to conversion.

- Storytelling & visual consistency: To strengthen brand trust & recognition.

Compliance & Brand Integrity

- Uphold regulatory & ethical communication standards across all marketing activities.

- Ensure all content complies with regulatory guidelines & marketing requirements in each country we operate in, including product claims, advertising language & digital promotions.

- Maintain brand credibility by ensuring all communications are factual & aligned with company values.

- Collaborate with internal teams to review materials for accuracy, effectiveness & compliance before publication.



Requirements:

- 3–5 years of experience in creative strategy, content creation, social media, or brand marketing — ideally in health supplements, healthcare or wellness.

- Strong understanding of social media trends & platform best practices (Meta (FB/IG), LinkedIn, TikTok, YouTube, Google, Generative AI).

- Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere Pro), CapCut, Canva, Figma, or similar tools.

- Excellent writing, editing & visual storytelling skills — adopt a strategic approach to design that integrates marketing & commercial goals.

- Excellent communication, project management & cross-functional collaboration skills.

- Familiarity with regulatory communication standards or track record in health supplements or healthcare industry is a plus.



Please send your applications to

title: Creative Website Designer & Developer for Complete Website Redesign (WordPress / Woo commerce/ elementor)/ Shopify)

Hours: Flexible, with some overlap with [your timezone]

Location: Remote – Philippines-based applicants only

Compensation: Competitive – based on skills and experience

title: Head of Customer Relations & Success
description:
Hi there !



We are looking for a Head of Customer Relations & Success for our fast growing education agency.



Your role will be to:

– Onboard clients setting them up for success. Involves understanding their profile really well, the goals they want to achieve, presenting them clearly their next steps and how we will help them, pairing them adequately with our staff, and checking in regularly to make sure they have an emotional quick win from the get-go.

– Actively ensure top-tier satisfaction of our client base (NPS Score tracking), gather feedback and bring back improvement ideas to the team.

– Handle any crises / emergencies swiftly & politely. Requires a customer facing / client first approach, executing with speed, and being results-driven.

– Acomodate clients if they need a mentor replacement, any form of additional support, or question.

– Monitor client journeys, making sure everyone is well set up for success (doing their requirements on time, they are being well attended to by our staff, etc.), and no one is left unattended / underserved.

– You will be expected to provide weekly reports on client satisfaction, issues solved, and improvements to implement.

– You will also be expected to regularly communicate with staff to ensure they are fulfilling clients properly, and they themselves are also supporting clients adequately.



Your overall goal is to ensure the success of each and every client in our growing client base.



This requires you to be very organised, disciplined, results-driven, client-facing,  and speedy in execution. Your priority is ensuring client satisfaction & success for all of our customers, and adding value to them in any way possible. In cases of emergency you can be expected to respond on week-ends.



Company Overview



MIM Prep is an education platform designed to help ambitious students (Bachelor, Master / MBA) land their dream programs. Our core service pairs applicants with a mentor currently studying at the school they’re targeting, creating a “big brother / big sister” relationship that guides them through every step of the application process. Backed by a specialist team, we support students with school selection, CVs, cover letters, essays, and interview prep, plus proven resources and frameworks to maximize their chances of admission. We’re a results-driven, client-first, remote team with key hubs in London and Dubai, united by one goal: helping students unlock life-changing educational opportunities. We’re a fast-growing, international, working primarily with students across Europe and the US. If you care about education, high standards, and helping young people unlock life-changing opportunities, you’ll fit right in here !

title: [Quick Hire] Remote VA Receptionist Full Time Admin Marketing
description:
Important: Our application process moves very quickly. If you are selected for the next rounds of interviews, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond quickly may be passed over in favor of others.



We are hiring a Remote Spa Receptionist to handle inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based role. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Retention depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, consistent attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, fast response time, and the ability to professionally handle complaints and de-escalate upset clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them in your reply, and answer each one thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Executive Assistant to Founder (Long-Term)
description:
Executive Assistant to Founder (Long-Term)





READ THIS ENTIRE POST BEFORE APPLYING



This is not a typical VA job. If you're looking for easy, low-stress work with flexible deadlines, this is not for you.



Let me be direct about what you're signing up for.





WHO I AM



I run multiple businesses simultaneously. I've hit capacity and need to delegate. I need someone who can take work OFF my plate—not add to it.



I don't need someone who can "help." I need someone who can EXECUTE.





THE BRUTAL TRUTH ABOUT THIS ROLE



Let me be upfront about the hard parts:



Minimal hand-holding. You'll receive clear instructions and context for each task—but I won't walk you through every step. I'll give you the outcome I need. You figure out how to get there.



Emergencies happen. If something critical breaks at 3am your time, we handle it. If a deadline is tomorrow, you stay up and get it done. This isn't every day, but when it happens, I need 100% reliability.



Direct feedback. When you make mistakes (everyone does), I'll tell you directly. No sugarcoating. If you're the type who takes feedback personally instead of using it to improve, this won't work.



High failure rate. If 10 people start a trial, expect 1-2 to make it.





WHY WOULD ANYONE WANT THIS JOB?



Here's what you get:



1. Direct access to a founder, not middle management.

You'll see how decisions are made at the top across multiple businesses. You'll learn by doing, not by watching.



2. Clear path to Executive Assistant ? Right-Hand Person.

I'm not looking for a task-rabbit. I'm looking for someone who can eventually run things when I'm not around.



3. Trust and autonomy once earned.

Micromanagement is exhausting for both of us. Prove yourself, and I'll give you the keys. I want to eventually hand off entire areas of responsibility—operating as my right hand, making decisions on my behalf.



4. Compensation grows with performance.

Starting rate post-probation is $3/hr. Performance is rewarded—raises and bonuses are on the table as you take on more responsibility.





WHAT I NEED FROM YOU



Non-negotiables:



• Minimum 2+ years VA experience (no exceptions—I don't have time to train basics)

• Excellent written AND spoken English (you'll be coordinating with other Filipino freelancers on my team, and we'll work together via Zoom calls—all communication is in English)

• Available for Zoom calls when needed (camera on, clear audio)

• Reliable internet and backup plan if it goes down

• Wise account for payments



The mindset I'm looking for:



• You have a high work ethic and thrive on getting things done

• You're career-first—this isn't a side gig

• You take ownership. "That's not my job" isn't in your vocabulary

• You're resourceful. AI is your friend. You solve problems before escalating

• You can handle pressure without crumbling

• You're direct. Shy and timid won't work here





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING



I'm in the middle of launching a startup. There's a mountain of tasks that need to get done, and I can't do them all myself. Your job is to take items off my plate and execute them.



This will vary week to week. Some examples:



• Completing assignments and action items I delegate

• Following up on tasks and keeping things moving

• Organizing information, documents, and files

• Communicating with tea
mbers on my behalf

• Handling whatever needs to get done to move the business forward



The work isn't predictable or repetitive. If you need a clearly defined job description with the same tasks every day, this isn't it.



Eventually (if you prove yourself):



• Taking ownership of entire workstreams

• Making decisions on my behalf





COMPENSATION & STRUCTURE



• Position type: Part-time

• Trial period: 2 weeks (fixed-fee per task)

• Probation period: Up to 3 months after passing trial (fixed-fee per task)

• Post-probation: Converted to hourly ($3/hr starting rate)

• Advancement: Executive Assistant promotion available based on performance, with compensation to match

• Timezone: PST

• Payment: Wise, bi-weekly





HOW TO APPLY



Send your application via 
 DM 



To confirm you've read this entire post, begin your cover letter with: "Time is the one resource we can't make more of."



Applications that don't start with this phrase will be automatically rejected.



In your application, include:



1. Your resume/CV



2. Answer these two questions:

   • "Describe a real situation where you handled an urgent, high-pressure task outside of normal working hours. What happened and what did you do?"

   • "If I gave you a task with unclear instructions, what would you do?"



3. Screenshot of your 16 Personalities test results: 



4. Screenshot of your DISC personality assessment results: 



5. Your Wise
 (for paid trial tasks if selected)





WHAT HAPPENS NEXT



Strong applicants will be contacted for next steps, which may include an interview and paid trial assignments. I review all applications personally.

title: AI Automation Engineer (Conversational Systems & WhatsApp Automation)
description:
About the role



bout the Role



We are building AI-driven conversational automation systems where AI directly impacts operations and conversion.



This role owns the design, implementation, and reliability of our AI chat automation across WhatsApp and messaging channels, using workflow logic, LLMs, and system integrations.



This is not an experimental or research role.

You will be responsible for production systems used by real customers at scale.



Key Responsibilities

1. Conversational Automation Design



Design and maintain workflow-based chat automation systems



Build structured, deterministic conversation flows for:



Lead qualification



Booking & scheduling



Pricing & service selection



Human handover



Decide when to use AI vs rule-based logic for accuracy, speed, and cost



Ensure conversations are efficient, clear, and conversion-focused



2. AI Prompt & Knowledge-Base Engineering



Write strict system prompts to prevent hallucination and invalid outputs



Design structured knowledge bases (tables, allowed values, forbidden fields)



Translate real business processes into AI-readable decision logic



Ensure AI responses are accurate, consistent, and business-safe



3. Systems Integration



Integrate chat automation with:



LLM APIs



CRM systems



Calendars / booking tools



Work with JSON payloads, APIs, and webhooks



Handle authentication, error handling, and data validation



Debug and resolve integration or message-delivery issues



4. Cost, Performance & Reliability Ownership



Optimise:



Message count



AI call frequency



Token usage



Design fallback logic for unexpected or invalid user input



Monitor live automation and prevent failure loops



Treat AI automation as mission-critical operational infrastructure



5. Continuous Improvement



Analyse real chat transcripts and user behaviour



Improve automation accuracy and reduce human workload



Iterate safely without breaking live systems



Scale proven flows across multiple business units



Required Skills & Experience (Must-Have)



Experience building chat or workflow-based automation systems



Strong understanding of conversational flow design



Practical experience deploying LLMs in production



Ability to write controlled, deterministic prompts



Comfortable working with:



JSON

title: Figma Designer with Conversion Optimization Experience (Part-Time, Remote)
description:
Hello there. 



We're looking for a UI/UX Figma designer who enjoys working on conversion-focused pages and collaborating on test ideas.

This is a part-time, long-term role with flexible workload, clear guidance, and open communication.



You don’t need to be a CRO expert. We’ll provide direction, explain what we’re trying to improve, and be available for questions. Your main job is to design clean, thoughtful variants in Figma and occasionally help think through ideas together.



What you’ll be working on:

- Designing and redesigning pages in Figma

- Creating variants for testing in Figma (based on existing pages we'll provide)



What this role is NOT:

- No coding or development

- No analytics, heatmaps, or data analysis

- No test setup or experiment running



Your deliverables are Figma designs only.



How we’ll work together:

- Clear briefs and examples provided

- Async communication (friendly and collaborative)

- We'll give constructive feedback, explain my reasoning, and I’m always open to hearing yours

- Weekly calls, plus quick check-ins if needed



Time & compensation

- $500/month

- Part-time, up to ~80 hours/month (often less)

- Monday–Friday

- Flexible schedule, just need to be responsive during workdays



What we're looking for

- Strong Figma skills

- Experience designing pages with conversion or A/B testing in mind

- Comfortable discussing ideas in English on calls

- Enjoys collaboration and iteration



How to apply:

If this sounds like a fit, please apply here:









Share a few Figma examples and a short note about your experience. No long case studies needed.



Looking forward to meeting you.

title: Remote VA Receptionist (Immediate Hire | 24-Hour Review)
description:
We are hiring a Remote Spa Receptionist for immediate placement. This role primarily handles inbound calls and appointment booking, but also includes additional administrative and operational tasks beyond call handling as assigned. Applications are reviewed within 24 hours for serious candidates, and this position requires immediate availability. All calls are recorded and monitored. Performance is strictly evaluated based on booking success, accuracy, professional phone presence, low drop-call rate, and adherence to scripts and procedures. This is a long-term role for candidates who can consistently meet expectations.

Note: We value authentic responses—please avoid overly generic or AI-generated answers.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected? 



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed. 



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute? 



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome. 



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional. 



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job? 



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired? 



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available. 



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: SETTING CALLER - EARN $1,000-$1,500 PER WEEK (?57K-?85K)
description:
PLEASE READ THE "HOW TO APPLY" PART BEFORE SENDING A MESSAGE 



THE OPPORTUNITY:

We're hiring full-time callers to contact existing clients about pre-funded trading accounts. You handle initial outreach via text and phone, then book them with our closer who finalizes the sale.

This is NOT cold calling. These are warm leads who already use our service and trust us.

Your job: Qualify interest, book the appointment. Our closers handle the pressure.



REALISTIC EARNINGS BREAKDOWN:

Weeks 1-4 (Commission Only): 15-20 successful calls per week = $900-$1,200/week

Weeks 5-8 (Commission Only): 25-30 successful calls per week = $1,500-$1,800/week

Current caller example: Earning $1,600/week average after 3 months.



BONUS STRUCTURE (ONLY 4 CALLERS IN TEAM):

Top Performer #1: $1,000 cash bonus monthly Top Performer #2: $500 cash bonus monthly

With only 4 people competing, your chances of winning are 50%. Every month.



YOUR DAILY WORKFLOW:

TEXTING (30% of your time):

Morning: Send outreach messages to existing clients about the pre-funded account offer Throughout day: Follow up with those who don't immediately reply After calls: Send booking confirmation texts and appointment reminders

You're using
 to contact warm leads (our existing bot users). These people know us and trust us. Response rates are high.

PHONING (70% of your time):

One call per interested prospect. Your goal: explain the offer briefly, qualify their interest, and book them for a call with our closer.

Average call length: 15 minutes. You are NOT closing the sale. You're setting the appointment. The closer handles all objections, pricing negotiations, and final sale.

Conversion rate: 40%+ of people you call end up buying.

This is extremely high because:

-They're already customers (warm audience)

-The offer is valuable

-It's an upsell (they already trust the main product)

-You follow a proven script



WHY THIS ROLE IS LOW PRESSURE:

- No cold calling (everyone knows us already)

- No closing (someone else handles that part)

- No rejection handling (closer deals with objections)

- Script provided (proven framework you follow)

- Warm leads (high response and conversion rates)

You're the bridge. You educate, qualify, and book. The closer does the heavy lifting.



WORK SCHEDULE:

Full-time: 40 hours per week Flexible within 9:00 AM to 11:00 PM CET (Central European Time) You choose your 8-hour window, but must have minimum 6 hours overlap with CET business hours

Example schedules that work:

3:00 PM - 11:00 PM Manila Time (9:00 AM - 5:00 PM CET)

4:00 PM - 12:00 AM Manila Time (10:00 AM - 6:00 PM CET)



NON-NEGOTIABLES (MUST HAVE ALL):

1. FLUENT ENGLISH (Speaking + Writing) You'll be calling and texting international clients. Must be clearly understood on the phone. Fluency is required. We will test this with a voice/video sample.

2. FULL-TIME COMMITMENT This is a 40-hour/week role. No side jobs, no part-time. We need consistency and focus.

3. STABLE INTERNET CONNECTION No frequent disconnections. You'll be on calls and need reliability. Backup internet solution required (mobile data as backup).

4. QUIET, PROFESSIONAL WORKSPACE You need a dedicated space where you can make calls without background noise. No crying babies, traffic sounds, or interruptions during calls. Professional environment essential.

5. QUALITY PHONE + HEADSET Clear audio is critical. You need a reliable smartphone or computer with a microphone/headset that produces crystal-clear sound. We will test audio quality before hiring.

6. PROVEN PHONE EXPERIENCE We need someone who has done phone-based sales, customer service, or appointment setting before.



WHAT MAKES YOU STAND OUT:

Previous experience in high-ticket sales or financial services

Experience with WhatsApp Business,
, or CRM systems

Track record of 50%+ appointment show rates as a setter

Comfortable discussing trading, investing, or prop firms (we'll train you, but prior knowledge helps)

Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision

Organized and detail-oriented (tracking follow-ups, updating CRM)



HOW TO APPLY:

Send the following to us on 
 or on whatsapp at 
. VOICE SAMPLE (REQUIRED) Record a 90-second video or audio introducing yourself. Tell us:

Your name and location

Your phone sales experience (specific results/numbers)

Why you want this role

Why you think you'll be good at it

This tests your English fluency and communication skills. Applications without voice samples will be automatically rejected.



2. WORK HISTORY 

List your last 3 jobs that involved phone work:

-Company name

-Role title

-Dates worked

-Key results (conversion rates, sales numbers, anything measurable)



3. INFRASTRUCTURE CONFIRMATION Confirm you have: 

- Stable internet (speed test screenshot) 

- Quiet workspace (describe your setup) 

- Quality phone/headset (brand/model) 

- Backup internet solution



4. AVAILABILITY Confirm you can: ? Start within 7 days if selected ? Work full-time (40 hours/week) ? Overlap with CET business hours (9 AM - 11 PM CET window)



RED FLAGS (DON'T APPLY IF):

- You're not truly fluent in English (we will test this)

- You don't have a quiet workspace (background noise = instant disqualification)

- You have unreliable internet (we track call quality metrics)

- You're looking for part-time or side work (this is full-time only)

- You've never done phone sales before (we need proven experience)

- You can't commit to the CET time overlap requirement



WHY WORK WITH US:

- Warm leads only (no cold calling grind)

- High conversion rates (40% vs industry average of 5-10%)

- No closing pressure (you set, closer handles sale)

- Monthly bonuses with real chances to win (only 4 people competing)

- Possible base salary after 3 months (financial stability kicks in)

- Remote flexibility (work from anywhere in your timezone)

- Real support (weekly training, daily check-ins, not left alone)



FINAL NOTE:

This role rewards consistency and quality. Our top caller last month made $6,800. Our lowest made $3,200. Both worked the same hours. We’re scaling fast and you can grow fast with us as well/

If you're methodical, coachable, and genuinely good on the phone, you'll thrive here. Contact us on
 
 or whatsapp at

 & Instagram ads

title: PART-TIME SEO SPECIALIST   (UK FINANCIAL SERVICES)
description:
Elite SEO Operator Wanted:



This is not a junior SEO role.

This is not basic keyword stuffing or “monthly reports with no results.”

If you are not operating at a high, proven level, please do not apply.

We are a fast-growing UK financial services company with one clear objective:

To become the #1 ranked financial services website in the UK.



We are looking for an exceptional Part-Time SEO Specialist, based in the Philippines, to help drive organic growth and build a dominant long-term SEO strategy.







YOUR ROLE

You will take ownership of SEO strategy and execution, including:

SEO Strategy & Growth

Build a clear SEO roadmap based on traffic + revenue opportunities

Identify high-value keywords in competitive UK finance niches

Create topic clusters, content strategy, and internal linking plans

Competitor analysis (what they rank for and how we outrank them)







Technical SEO

Perform regular SEO audits (site structure, indexing, crawlability)

Fix or advise on technical issues (speed, redirects, canonicals, errors)

Improve Core Web Vitals, site architecture and UX SEO performance

Implement / advise on structured data (Schema)







On-Page SEO

Optimise pages for rankings + conversion (titles, meta, headings, intent)

Improve content depth, structure, and topical authority

Ensure best-practice internal linking and page hierarchy







E-E-A-T / YMYL SEO

Understand and apply SEO strategies for UK financial services

Build authority signals and content trust frameworks

Ensure compliance-style positioning (trust, credibility, clarity)







WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

This role is SEO-only.



You do not need to be a web designer or developer, but you MUST understand technical SEO well enough to work alongside developers and give precise implementation instructions.







You must have:

Proven results ranking competitive websites

Strong understanding of technical SEO + on-page SEO

Experience with SEO for finance, legal or other YMYL niches

Ability to think strategically (not just “tasks”)

If your SEO experience is limited to small local businesses or low-competition niches, this is not a fit.





WHAT “ELITE SEO” MEANS TO US

You can show real ranking wins (not vague case studies)

You understand Google’s algorithm logic and search intent deeply

You can build a long-term SEO engine, not quick hacks

You care about structure, precision, and execution

You understand how to build authority and dominate competitive SERPs







WORKING HOURS

Part-time role

Flexible hours

Long-term opportunity for the right person







WHAT WE OFFER

Long-term stable position (not a one-off project)

Competitive compensation aligned with top-tier PH talent

Direct communication with the business owner (fast decisions, no fluff)

Opportunity to help build one of the most authoritative financial websites in the UK

Future expansion into content scaling, funnels, CRO & SEO growth projects







HOW TO APPLY

To apply, you MUST include:

A short introduction explaining why you consider yourself high-level in SEO

Links to your best 3 SEO case studies or ranking results

A brief explanation of how you approach SEO for competitive industries

Tools you use (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Surfer, etc.)





Applications that do not follow these steps will not be reviewed.

s using provided scripts

, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, X, etc.)

 / Newsletter

 platforms (Mailchimp, Constant Contact, Klaviyo, etc.)

Travel/event access opportunities

Long-term growth potential with the brand



How to Apply

Availability & Desired Compensation.

Riders, Rebels, and Rally Lovers — the countdown is ON! Daytona Bike Week is getting closer and the Camp Easy Ride compound is already gearing up for another unforgettable experience. If you’re ready for zero setup, zero stress, and maximum fun… we’ve got your spot waiting.

Simply Arrive. Party. Drop. Repeat. Leave.



We’re looking for someone who can capture the vibe, grow the tribe, and keep the party alive online — and in inboxes every week. If you understand energy, community, and bold branding, this role was built for you.

title: Talent Operations Manager
description:
we are building a new self-service recruitment platform that connects high-quality international talent (Philippines, LATAM, Eastern Europe) with companies in Europe.



The platform will launch in a few months.

Before launch, our top priority is to build a clean, well-organized, high-quality talent pool that can later be imported directly into the platform.



For this, we are looking for a Talent Operations Manager who can fully own this process from start to finish.



This role is designed to be hands-off for the founder.

You will be responsible for sourcing, onboarding, organizing, and preparing talent profiles in a structured way.





What You Will Be Responsible For

 • Proactively source qualified candidates for defined job categories

 • Communicate with candidates in clear, professional English

 • Guide candidates through onboarding (photo, intro video, CV, portfolio, salary, availability)

 • Ensure all information is complete, clean, and structured

 • Organize candidate data in:

 • Google Sheets (main database)

 • Google Drive (photos, videos, documents)

 • Perform basic vetting:

 • English level

 • Experience & tools

 • Profile quality

 • Maintain clear status tracking (applied, vetted, approved)

 • Prepare profiles so they can later be imported directly into the platform (Bubble)



What Success Looks Like in This Role

 • Each candidate has:

 • A complete profile

 • High-quality photo

 • Short intro video

 • Clear role, skills, and salary expectations

 • The talent pool looks professional, trustworthy, and ready to present to European companies

 • The founder does not need to manage individual candidates





What We Are Looking For

 • Experience in recruitment, talent sourcing, or HR operations

 • Strong English communication skills

 • Very organized and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable working independently

 • Experience with:

 • OnlineJobs.ph, LinkedIn, Upwork, or similar platforms

 • Google Sheets & Google Drive

 • Ability to judge quality over quantity

 • Proactive mindset – you suggest improvements, not just follow instructions



Very Important – How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:

 1. A short introduction about your background

 2. Which types of roles you have recruited or worked with before

 3. How you would approach this project step by step, including:

 • Where you would source candidates

 • How you would screen and vet them

 • How you would keep the database clean and organized

 4. How many high-quality candidates per week you realistically think you can deliver



Applications without point 3 will not be considered.





Thank you :)!!

title: Customer Success Lead (Legal Tech / Remote)
description:
Salary: $1,500 – $2,000 / month (with scope to increase as responsibilities expand)



We are a high-growth legal tech startup with global ambitions, helping individuals with their estate planning needs. We currently operate in the UAE, US, and UK. 



We are looking for an emotionally intelligent human to initially handle the full range of customer inquiries, and to systematically turn those conversations into structured knowledge that trains our AI agent and reduces the need for human involvement over time.



You will work with a high degree of autonomy, be trusted to make judgment calls, and help shape how customer support is done as the company scales.



What you’ll do



- Handle customer inquiries across chat and messaging channels (e.g. Intercom,
).

- Translate complex or unfamiliar processes (legal steps, government fees, timelines) into reassuring explanations.

- De-escalate emotionally charged situations calmly and professionally, even when issues cannot be resolved immediately.

- Identify recurring customer questions, points of friction, or misunderstandings and turn the answers into a reusable knowledge base.

- Help define when a conversation should stay with AI and when a human should step in.

- Continuously improve tone, clarity, and consistency of customer communication as the company scales.



What we’re looking for



- Availability to support customers during UAE business hours.

- Strong written English and the ability to sound calm, confident, and human under pressure.

- High emotional intelligence. You can spot fear, frustration, or confusion quickly and respond appropriately.

- Process-oriented thinking. You don’t like answering the same question 20 times if it can be solved once.

- Comfort working with AI tools (or curiosity to learn).

- Ability to work independently and take ownership in an early-stage, fast-moving environment.

- Prior experience in fintech, legal tech, or other high-trust services is a plus, but not required. 



How to apply



To apply, please provide your CV and answer the three questions below directly in your application message. We do not require a cover letter.



Question 1:



"A client messages at 8:00 PM on a Friday: “I am leaving for a holiday tomorrow and I still haven't received my will! Is this a scam? It’s been almost a week and your website says 2 days. I need this NOW.”



Draft the exact WhatsApp reply you would send. 

(Note: You cannot actually fix the issue until Monday morning, but you need to de-escalate him immediately).



Question 2:



You notice that 20 different customers asked the exact same question this week: “How much are the court registration fees for a will?”



How do you solve this permanently? Explain the process you would set up so that you never have to type that answer manually in WhatsApp again. The fees are $200 USD per will. 



Question 3: 



Have you ever used tools like ChatGPT or Claude for work? What problem were you trying to solve, and how did you use the tool to solve it? Please be specific.

title: Join the 'Disney' of Short-Stays as a Concierge Team Member
description:
We are the Disney of the short-stay industry.



Every stay is designed, choreographed, and delivered with the same intention you’d expect from a world-class global brand — where emotion matters, details matter, and the experience is remembered long after check-out.



This role is not customer support.

It is not a script-reading position.

It is not a place to hide behind automation.



We are looking for real brand ambassadors, people who understand that how something is said matters just as much as what is said.



--------------------



The Role

As a Concierge, you are the living expression of the brand.



You are the voice guests trust.

You are the tone they remember.

You are the reason a stay feels thoughtful, intentional, and human.



Guests are not interacting with software or templates.

They are interacting with you, and through you, the brand.



--------------------



What You’ll Be Responsible For

1. Serve as the primary point of contact for guests before, during, and after their stay

2. Deliver warm, confident, articulate communication across booking platforms, phone,
, and SMS

3. Represent the brand’s values, tone, and standards in every interaction

4. Ensure each guest experience feels seamless, considered, and personal

5. Resolve guest issues (A/C, Wi-Fi, access, appliances, etc.) calmly and decisively

6. Coordinate solutions with cleaning, maintenance, and building teams

7. Communicate disruptions or building notices with clarity and professionalism

8. Take ownership of outcomes, not just messages

9. Maintain a deep understanding of each property’s layout, features, and nuances

10. Coordinate with housekeeping teams to ensure spaces are guest-ready at all times

11. Speak confidently and accurately about each space and its surroundings

12. Maintain clear guest notes, handovers, and internal updates

13. Work in rhythm with the wider team to deliver consistency at scale



-----------------------



Non-Negotiables



1. Fluent English is essential.

You must communicate clearly, confidently, and naturally — both written and spoken.



2. No AI-generated guest communication.

ChatGPT or similar tools are not permitted for guest interactions.

This brand is built on real conversations with real people.



3. You represent something bigger than yourself.

This role requires pride, presence, and care in how you show up every day.



4. This is a role in a brand.

We are selective because every person in this position shapes how the world experiences us.



------------------------



Video Application (Required)



All applicants must submit a short video answering:



1. Who you are and how you present yourself

2. Your experience in hospitality or short-term stays (if any)

3. What being a brand ambassador means to you

4. If you were told you were joining the Disney of the short-stay industry, how would that change the way you approach your work?

title: Business Manager
description:
Operations assistant — StressKnotNYC

Location: Remote (U.S. time zones preferred)

Schedule: 5days/week coverage (rotational shifts)

Compensation: Competitive base + performance incentives (details shared with finalists)



StressKnotNYC is not a “massage company.”

We are a premium, mobile wellness and recovery brand built in New York City, serving high-performing professionals, executives, hotels, and corporate clients who expect five-star experiences every time.



Our promise is simple but non-negotiable:

Right practitioner. Right time. Five-star execution. Zero excuses.



We operate in a fast-paced environment where:



Clients expect immediate responses

Same-day bookings are common

Therapist dispatch is mission-critical

Every lead matters

Every interaction reflects the brand



We are building systems that scale — and we are looking for an elite Operations Manager who can run the engine, convert leads, and own outcomes.



THIS IS NOT A “TASK” ROLE

This role is for someone who:



Thinks in systems and outcomes, not checklists

Understands that operations = revenue protection + revenue growth

Is calm under pressure, decisive, and proactive

Treats every inbound lead like money on the table

If you are someone who needs constant direction, avoids accountability, or is uncomfortable with urgency — this role is not for you.



CORE MISSION OF THE ROLE



The Operations Manager is responsible for ensuring that every inbound inquiry is handled quickly, professionally, and converted at the highest possible rate, while maintaining seamless day-to-day operations.



Your job is to:

Protect revenue

Increase conversion

Eliminate operational friction

Ensure five-star delivery every single day



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Lead Management & Conversion (Top Priority)

You are the first line of revenue defense.

Answer inbound calls, texts,
s, and website inquiries promptly

Respond with confidence, warmth, and authority

Qualify leads and guide them to booking — not just “answer questions”

Handle objections calmly (pricing, availability, same-day requests, therapist preferences)

Follow up relentlessly but professionally until a clear yes or no

Understand that speed + clarity + confidence = conversions

You are expected to think like a closer, even if a deal is escalated.



2. Scheduling, Dispatch & Fulfillment

Assign the right therapist or practitioner based on:

Client needs

Location

Availability

Gender preferences (when requested)

Handle same-day and last-minute bookings without panic

Communicate clearly with therapists and clients

Ensure sessions are confirmed, executed, and followed up properly

Anticipate issues before they become problems



3. Therapist & Practitioner Coordination

Support therapist onboarding and interview scheduling

Maintain therapist availability and responsiveness

Act as a professional point of contact for practitioners

Ensure therapists follow brand standards and protocols

Communicate expectations clearly and respectfully



4. Client Experience & Retention

Deliver white-glove customer service at every touchpoint

Manage reschedules, cancellations, refunds, and credits professionally

Proactively request 5-star reviews after positive experiences

Ensure post-session follow-ups are completed

Identify opportunities to upsell, rebook, or retain clients



5. Systems, SOPs & Accountability

Follow existing SOPs precisely

Help identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies

Track daily KPIs including:

Inbound leads

Bookings

Conversion rate

Missed calls

Reviews requested/received

Maintain clean records in CRM and internal tools

Operate with ownership — not excuses



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

A successful Operations Manager at StressKnotNYC:

Converts leads consistently and confidently

Keeps operations running smoothly even on busy days

Handles pressure without emotional reactivity

Communicates clearly, professionally, and proactively

Anticipates needs instead of reacting late

Treats the business as if it were their own



NON-NEGOTIABLE QUALITIES (READ CAREFULLY)

We are only interested in candidates who demonstrate:

Extreme ownership — no blame, no deflection

Strong communication skills (spoken & written English)

Sales-oriented mindset (you understand conversion)

High urgency + high standards

Emotional maturity under pressure

Ability to follow systems while improving them

Reliability — you show up, every day, without chasing





WHO THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR



This role is not for:

Task-takers who wait for instructions

People who avoid phone calls

Candidates who struggle with urgency or accountability

Anyone uncomfortable with sales-adjacent responsibilities

People who disappear, miss shifts, or need micromanagement



WHY JOIN STRESSKNOTNYC



You will work directly with the founder

You will have real ownership and impact

You will be part of a brand scaling toward national expansion

Your performance directly influences growth and opportunity

This is a long-term role for the right person



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)



To apply, you must submit:

A short voice or video intro explaining why you believe operations = revenue

Your resume



Candidates who do not follow instructions will not be considered.

title: Video Editor – YouTube (Business Content) Part-Time
description:
Looking for a LONG TERM Editor. 



----> Key Responsibilities



Edit YouTube videos with basic editing. 



My content is talking head, education type of videos. So I do a mix of screensharing and speaking just myself in front of a camera. More demonstration/tutorial type of content. Specifically Amazon FBA Business related.



I am looking to grow my YouTube specifically for business. So all content will be purposeful and each video will target our Ideal audience for that type of content. Some videos will be tailored toward beginner's looking to get started, others tailor towards experienced sellers who need assistance scaling their company. 





Editing Responsibilities:





- Clean cuts



- Removing mistakes / dead space



- Basic pacing and flow



- Some graphical edits/transitions (very minimal)





Create thumbnails:





- Clear text



- Clean layout with background and my face in the thumbnail



- No advanced design required. I will provide examples if accepted.





Expectations:





- Deliver edits within a 24–48 hour turnaround.



- Communicate clearly and meet deadlines consistently.





As you grow, assist with:





- Increased video volume



- Repurposing content into short-form clips or creating new content via short form (later)













----> What We’re Looking For





- Coachable, reliable, and open to feedback.



- Strong attention to detail.



- Follows a clear process while expressing skill/creativity. 



- Basic familiarity with video editing software (ex. Capcut)



- Basic familiarity with Canva or another web design software. 



- Reliable internet and clear communication.





You do not need to be an advanced editor — this role is primarily execution-focused.









----> COMPENSATION





- $225 USD per month



- Covers a minimum of 3 YouTube videos per week. No more than 4 max. Additional videos will create increased pay opportunities. 



- Basic editing scope



- Opportunity to increase pay as output and responsibilities grow





This is a part-time, long-term role. You will be our go-to editor.







----> PERKS





- Flexible schedule within deadlines. I will notify ahead of time when I plan to create videos, to give you time to prepare. 



- Clear expectations and structured workflow.



- Paid training and feedback.



- Long-term opportunity as the channel grows.



- Future pay increases based on volume and performance.









----> How to Apply





- Video Intro (1–2 minutes):

 Introduce yourself and briefly explain:



Any editing experience you have. Short form, long form, etc. Also what type of content have you worked with.



Why this role interests you





- Resume: Attach your most recent resume.





- Editing Software:

 List the editing software you are most comfortable using at the end of your application.





- Favorite Color (Share at the end of Application)





!!! Only applicants who follow all four steps will be considered.
