title: Talent Acquisition & Strategic Recruitment Manager
description:
The Talent Acquisition & Strategic Recruitment Manager is responsible for proactively identifying, recruiting, and securing top-tier talent across the business.



This is not a passive recruiting role.

You are expected to hunt, headhunt, and build pipelines for:

Licensed massage therapists (priority: female and senior practitioners)

Acupuncturists and recovery specialists

Key operational, sales, and growth roles as the company scales



You work closely with leadership to ensure talent never becomes the bottleneck to growth.



Core Responsibilities

Strategic Talent Acquisition

Proactively source and headhunt talent through outreach, referrals, and direct engagement

Build pipelines for current and future hiring needs

Recruit both practitioners and internal tea
mbers as required

Adapt recruiting strategy as business priorities evolve



Practitioner Recruitment (High Priority)

Recruit licensed massage therapists with an emphasis on reliability, professionalism, and client presence

Source female therapists and senior practitioners where demand requires

Recruit licensed acupuncturists and advanced recovery professionals

Verify licenses, credentials, and compliance requirements



Operational & Growth Hiring

Recruit for operations, dispatch, sales, and support roles as needed

Assist leadership in defining role requirements before hiring

Screen for communication skills, ownership, and execution ability



Vetting, Onboarding & Quality Control

Conduct screening calls and interviews

Ensure candidates align with StressKnotNYC’s standards and values

Support onboarding handoffs with Operations

Remove or replace underperforming talent when necessary



What Success Looks Like

Talent pipelines exist before demand spikes

Female therapist availability improves consistently

Acupuncturist and specialist coverage expands

Operations and sales roles are filled quickly with high-quality candidates

Hiring no longer slows growth



KPIs (Non-Negotiable)

Roles filled per month

Practitioner availability coverage

Time-to-hire

Retention of recruited talent

Hiring quality (measured by performance feedback)



Who This Role Is For

A proactive recruiter or headhunter

Someone who thrives on outreach and relationship-building

Comfortable recruiting across multiple disciplines

Able to pivot quickly as priorities change

Confident communicating with licensed professionals and executives



What This Role Is NOT

Not a job-posting-only recruiter

Not HR administration

Not volume hiring without standards



This is a strategic growth role.

Compensation

Contract-based with performance incentives

Pay tied to successful placements and outcomes

Long-term growth opportunity as the company scales



(Details discussed during interview.)



How to Apply

To apply, please submit:

Your resume 



A short written response explaining:

Your experience sourcing or headhunting talent

How you approach recruiting for hard-to-fill roles



A short voice recording (1–2 minutes) answering:

Introduce yourself

Describe how you would recruit high-quality practitioners or operators for a premium brand

Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.



Growth Path

This role can evolve into:

Head of Talent & Network Expansion

Director of People & Practitioner Strategy

title: Human Resources Officer
description:
Job Title: Human Resources (HR) Generalist

Shift: US Pacific Time (Flexible Workload)

No. hours per week: 30 hours per week (can be 40 if you're trustworthy)

Work Setup: Remote

Experience: 3+ years in Human Resources



PLEASE READ FIRST



We are hiring a strategic and adaptable HR Generalist who moves with workload cycles, not just scheduled hours online. Some shifts will be intense during recruitment peaks and payroll runs. Other shifts will be quiet. 



NOTE: WE DON'T US TIME TRACKERS



We don’t pay someone to idle or clock in like a security guard watching a post. We need someone who learns demand patterns and adjusts output flexibly. 



The last HR people we worked with were very rigid with their time. They refused to be flexible and insisted on a fixed 8-hour schedule, even when there were no tasks. Some of those hours were spent sleeping or idling instead of working, which didn’t align with how this role operates.



What You’ll Do

- Lead full-cycle recruitment for internal roles and Virtual Assistants

- Audit contractor logged hours and validate them before payroll and billing

- Process payroll cycles accurately and confidentially

- Conduct one-on-one check-ins focused on performance, accountability, and well-being

- Manage onboarding, orientation, and HR documentation for new hires and contractors

- Organize engagement and culture-building activities to boost morale and retention

- Cross-check schedules, tracked hours, and expected workload patterns for alignment

- Protect all confidential HR and payroll information with strict discretion



What We’re Looking For

- 3+ years of HR experience, with strong recruitment exposure

- Payroll processing and contractor hours auditing background

- Ability to adapt to fluctuating workloads and graveyard operations

- High ownership mindset and pattern-based scheduling awareness

- Strong confidentiality practices and secure data handling

- Independent execution without micromanagement



This Role Is NOT For

- Attendance-first workers who expect to be paid to idle

- Presence-based mindset professionals (we value output over online time)

- Guard-post mentality applicants



For interested applicants, please
: 
 will not entertain applicants who will not send
.

Please include your resume and use the subject: Human Resources Applicants

title: Executive Personal Assistant
description:
We're seeking an exceptional Executive Personal Assistant to support the CEO of two growing companies: a multi-office law firm and a SaaS software company. This is a high-trust, high-impact role for someone who thrives on variety, takes pride in flawless execution, and wants to grow alongside a dynamic leader.



You'll be the CEO's right hand across both businesses and personal matters—managing calendars, coordinating communications, supporting software testing, handling research, and tackling whatever comes next. No two days will look the same, and that's exactly what makes this role exciting.



This position is ideal for someone who is sharp, proactive, and genuinely enjoys making someone else's life easier while building real skills across legal operations, SaaS, and executive support.



What You'll Do

Executive & Administrative Support



Manage complex calendars with zero errors—scheduling, rescheduling, and anticipating conflicts before they happen

Handle
 correspondence, prioritize communications, and draft responses on behalf of the CEO

Coordinate travel, meetings, and personal appointments

Serve as a gatekeeper and liaison for internal teams and external contacts



Software & SaaS Operations



Learn and support the CEO's software company operations

Assist with product testing, including end-to-end QA testing

Help set up and manage testing tools (e.g., BugBug)

Troubleshoot issues, document bugs, and communicate with development teams

Navigate CRMs, dashboards, and project management tools with ease



General Support



Handle research projects across legal, software, and personal topics

Support marketing and administrative tasks as needed (Canva, Meta Suite, content scheduling)

Take on personal tasks to keep the CEO's life running smoothly

Represent the CEO professionally on video calls when required





Who You Are



Polished & Professional — How you appear and sound on camera matters a great deal as you are a reflection of your employer. The greater your appeal and clarity, the more likely you are a good fit for this role. 

Obsessively Detail-Oriented — You catch what others miss. Errors aren't in your vocabulary

Trustworthy & Discreet — You'll have access to sensitive information across a law firm, a tech company, and personal matters. Confidentiality is non-negotiable

A Quick Study — You pick things up fast. Whether it's a new tool, a new process, or a new industry, you figure it out

Proactive & Resourceful — You solve problems before they become problems. You don't wait to be told what to do

Reliable to the Core — You show up. Every day. Every task. No excuses

Emotionally Intelligent — You navigate complex interactions with grace and know how to read a room (even a virtual one)





Requirements



Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or Executive Assistant supporting entrepreneurs, executives, or high-profile clients

Strong English communication skills—written and verbal (you'll be drafting
s, joining calls, and representing the CEO)

Experience with or strong interest in SaaS products and software operations

Technical fluency: Google Workspace, CRMs, project management tools, Canva, analytics dashboards

Reliable high-speed internet and a professional home office setup

Availability during agreed-upon hours via Slack and WhatsApp

Webcam-ready setup for video calls





Nice to Have



Experience in legal operations, law firms, or legal tech

Familiarity with QA testing, bug tracking, or software development workflows

Background supporting founders or CEOs of multiple businesses





How to Apply

If you're serious about this position, create a short Loom video (1–3 minutes) introducing yourself. In your video, explain:



Why you're a strong fit for this role

How you'd contribute to this position

How this role fits into your long-term career plans



Applications without a Loom video will not be considered.



This is a role for someone who wants to be indispensable. If that's you, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Senior Local SEO Specialist
description:
Senior SEO Specialist – Full-Time + Remote



$1,300-1,800/month base + $100-$500/month performance bonus



About Us



We're a fast-growing SEO agency helping local service businesses dominate search results. Our team is small, sharp, and results-driven. We value clear communication and extreme ownership. We stay ahead of our industry with heavy investment in AI systems. We're US-based, serving US clients exclusively.



About the Role



We're hiring a full-time contract SEO specialist (4–5+ years of experience) to own 6-12 local SEO client campaigns end to end. You'll manage strategy (alongside the team lead), execution, reporting, and client deliverables - with autonomy over how you manage your time and make decisions.



This isn't just a task-completion role. Our clients are real business owners whose livelihoods depend on results. We need someone who feels the weight of that and operates accordingly: flagging issues early, bringing solutions, and keeping campaigns moving forward without being asked. You'll earn performance bonuses tied directly to problem solving and client retention.



What You'll Do



- Manage the full SEO lifecycle for 6–12 clients

- Run comprehensive audits: technical, local, content, backlink, etc

- Conduct keyword research and execute on-page, technical, local, and content SEO strategies

- Optimize Google Business Profiles

- Configure and manage GA4, GSC, and GTM

- Track performance, send weekly internal updates, and build monthly client reports

- Use AI tools to streamline workflows, solve problems independently, and contribute to internal automation projects



Required Qualifications



- 4-5+ years managing local SEO campaigns with proven results

- Experience managing multiple client accounts simultaneously

- Strong knowledge of local SEO (Map Pack, GBP optimization) and organic SEO

- Comfortable with basic HTML/CSS and writing technical SEO guidelines

- Hands-on experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for research, content, troubleshooting, and/or automation

- Familiarity with core SEO tools: GA4, GSC, GTM, Ahrefs or SEMrush, Screaming Frog, and local SEO tools (Local Dominator, Local Falcon, or similar)

- Native English proficiency

- Reliable high-speed internet



Who You Are



- Accountable - You see tasks through and own the outcome, good or bad

- Self-managed - You deliver quality work consistently without needing oversight

- Proactive - You surface updates, flag risks, and solve problems before they escalate

- Results-focused - You care about what the work produces, not just checking boxes

- AI-forward - You already use AI in your daily work and are excited to push further

- Collaborative - You share knowledge openly, take feedback well, and leave ego at the door



What We Offer



- Compensation: $1,300–$1,800/month USD base (based on experience) + $100-$500/month performance bonuses tied to campaign health and client retention

- Employment type: Full-time independent contractor

- Schedule: CST business hours

- Location: 100% remote

- Growth: Clear path to Senior Lead or Team Manager as we scale

- Learning: Paid access to training resources and industry consultants



How to Apply



Submit the following to 



- Resume

- 2-3 case studies with specific metrics (map rankings, organic traffic, leads generated, etc.)

- A 2 minute video (YouTube, Loom, or similar) answering:

---> What's your name?

---> What motivates you in your life? (Be honest)

---> What's the coolest result you've driven with SEO?

---> Why are you a good fit for this role?



Do NOT just read off of AI please.



No video = automatic pass. We use this to assess communication skills and personality fit — keep it casual.

title: AI Automation Specialist (WhatsApp & Chat Automation)
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a solid AI Automation Specialist to own and maintain our AI-powered WhatsApp and chat automation system.



This role focuses on designing, maintaining, and optimising AI-assisted chat workflows that handle customer enquiries, bookings, and routing — replacing and supporting human customer service operations.



This is not a software engineering role and not AI research.

It is a logic-driven automation and operations role.



What You Will Do



You will be the primary owner of our AI chat automation.



Core Responsibilities



Design and maintain chat automation workflows



Configure AI responses, prompts, and guardrails



Build multi-step logic for enquiries, bookings, and routing



Handle intent detection and escalation to human agents



Test edge cases (unclear intent, wrong info, user changes mind)



Monitor live conversations and optimise performance



Maintain clear documentation of workflows and rules



You Will NOT



Write backend or frontend code



Train AI models



Build websites or mobile apps



Do machine learning or data science



Required Skills (Must-Have)



We are looking for someone solid and experienced, not entry-level.



You should have experience in some of the following:



WhatsApp or chat automation platforms



Chatbot or CRM automation workflows



Designing logic-based conversation flows



Prompt writing with clear rules and boundaries



Handling human handover and exception cases



Strong logical thinking and attention to detail



Good documentation habits



Nice to Have (Not Mandatory)



Experience with automation tools (Zapier, Make, etc.)



Basic understanding of webhooks or APIs



Experience supporting or replacing customer service teams



Operations or process-improvement background



What We Care About (Very Important)



We care more about thinking and reliability than buzzwords.



You should be able to explain:



What an AI chat should do when it is unsure



When automation should stop and escalate to a human



How to prevent wrong replies or wrong bookings



Salary & Work Arrangement



Salary: USD 800– 1,000 / month (based on experience)



Location: Philippines (remote, home-based)



Working hours: Aligned with Singapore time (GMT+8)



Employment: Full-time, long-term



Why This Role Is Different



You own the automation logic



Your work directly impacts operations and revenue



Stable, long-term role (not freelance or project-based)



Clear scope — no random tech tasks



Application Instructions (Mandatory)



To apply, please include:



A short description of your experience with chat or workflow automation



ONE example of a workflow you built

(describe the logic and decision flow, no screenshots needed)



Answer this question:

“What should an AI chat do when it does not fully understand the user’s intent?”



Applications that do not follow the above will not be considered.



Final Note (Filters the Right Candidates)



This role is not for beginners and not for programmers.

It is for someone who enjoys building reliable automation systems and thinking through real-world customer scenarios.

title: AI Image & Video Generation Expert
description:
We are seeking a visionary architect of the digital age—someone whose imagination outpaces the tools they use. You don't just execute on a brief; you expand it, bringing a rare blend of creative intuition and conceptual depth to every frame



We can start you as part-time, then transition to a full-time role in our growing Company. 



1. Next-Gen Visual Production

Hyper-Realistic Mastery: Elevate AI beyond the uncanny valley. You’ll craft product imagery so crisp and textured it rivals $50k studio shoots, with an obsessive eye for light physics and material depth.



Cinematic Motion: Defy the "AI look." Using Veo 3.1, you’ll produce organic, human-centric video—from high-fashion lifestyle spots to high-converting UGC—where every frame feels intentional and cinematic.



The Power Stack: Command a sophisticated workflow centered on Nano Banana Pro, pushing the limits of the model to squeeze out every drop of fidelity and realism.



2. Brand Logic & Aesthetic Continuity

The Style Chameleon: Master the art of the "visual echo." You can reverse-engineer any aesthetic—be it moody noir or airy luxury—and replicate it with 100% precision across entire campaigns.



Luxury Stewardship: Act as the ultimate gatekeeper of brand DNA. You ensure every pixel breathes "premium," maintaining a seamless visual flow that builds deep consumer trust.



AI Art Direction: You aren't just a prompt engineer; you’re a digital auteur. You apply high-level art direction to ensure AI outputs meet the rigorous standards of global luxury brands.



3. Viral Innovation & UGC Strategy

Concept to Conversion: Transform raw ideas into scroll-stopping visual narratives. You don’t just "make content"; you build visual experiences that align with strategic business goals.



The UGC Edge: Bridge the gap between "polished" and "authentic." You’ll engineer high-performing UGC that feels raw and relatable but remains sophisticated enough for a premium brand’s feed.



4. Elite Post-Production & Scalability

The Final Polish: Use a master’s touch in post-production to scrub away artifacts and add that final 5% of "magic" that makes AI content indistinguishable from reality.



Future-Proof Workflows: Design the blueprints for scale. You’ll build repeatable, high-velocity pipelines that maintain rigorous quality control without sacrificing creative soul.

title: Animated Video Editor – YouTube & Shorts/Reels
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



About the Role:

We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Animated Video Editor who can produce engaging animated content for YouTube and short-form platforms such as Shorts, Reels, and TikTok. You will transform scripts and voiceovers into visually compelling videos using motion graphics, text animation, and visual storytelling techniques.



What You’ll Do:

- Edit and produce animated videos for YouTube long-form and short-form vertical content

- Turn scripts and voiceovers into dynamic visual stories

- Create motion graphics, character or 2D animations, text animations, transitions, and visual effects

- Design engaging hooks and fast-paced intros optimized for viewer retention

- Adapt content into multiple formats (16:9, 9:16, 1:1)

- Collaborate with scriptwriters and content managers on creative direction

- Source royalty-free assets (images, music, SFX) when needed

- Meet production deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously

- Stay updated with editing trends used by top YouTube and short-form creators



Qualifications:

- Proven experience as an animated video editor or motion graphics editor

- Strong familiarity with YouTube content style and Shorts/Reels editing

- Proficiency in tools such as: After Effects, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve or animation tools such as Blender, Toon Boom, Moho, CapCut, etc.

- Ability to create fast-paced, high-retention edits

- Strong sense of timing, pacing, and visual storytelling

- Ability to work with AI or human voiceovers

- Portfolio or demo reel required



Nice to Have:

- Experience editing faceless YouTube channels

- Knowledge of kinetic typography

- Basic illustration or graphic design skills

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics and audience retention trends

- Experience with templates and asset libraries



If interested in applying, please submit a sample video reel on any sport-related topic and also attach an accessible link to your resume in the
. Please put as subject title "Applying for Animated Video Editor"

title: Male Voice Actor (Anime / General Voice Acting)
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



Job Overview:

We are looking for a Male Voice Actor with strong skills in anime voice acting, character dubbing, and general voice over work. The ideal candidate can deliver expressive, dynamic, and high-quality audio for anime-style projects, digital media, and storytelling content. This role is perfect for someone passionate about anime characters, voice performance, and remote voice acting.



Key Responsibilities:

- Perform anime-style voices, character voices, and general voice overs based on script direction

- Record clean and high-quality audio using your home studio setup

- Interpret scripts, portray emotions accurately, and follow creative instructions

- Adjust performance based on feedback from the creative team

- Submit recordings on time and communicate any delays

- Maintain consistent audio quality and proper file labeling



Qualifications:

- Preferably female speaking fluent in English

- Experience in voice acting, voice over, anime dubbing, or character narration especially in YouTube

- Ability to perform a range of female anime voices—youthful, mature, energetic, soft, dramatic, comedic, etc

- Clear diction, strong emotion delivery, and acting capabilities.

- Must have a quiet recording environment and quality microphone

- Able to basic audio editing skills (Audacity, Adobe Audition, Reaper)

- Ability to follow directions and adapt quickly

- Reliable and responsive remote worker



How to Apply!

Please submit your resume plus a Vocaroo link using the anime script below.



Anime Script (Frieren-Inspired)

[Scene: A quiet forest at dusk. Soft wind. The female mage walks alone, speaking as if remembering someone important.]



I’ve walked this path more times than I can count… but it still feels different every time. The trees change, the wind shifts, even the scent of the air reminds me of how long it’s been. Mortals live their lives so quickly… and yet, somehow, their memories stay with me longer than they ever stayed in this world.



(soft laugh, bittersweet)

Funny, isn’t it? I used to think time was something endless—something only I had to worry about. But now… now I finally understand why they cherished every sunrise. Every conversation. Every simple 
nt.



(pauses, voice softening)

I can still hear them. Their footsteps, their laughter, the way they argued over the smallest things. I thought those days would last forever. But forever… was only a blink for them.



(more emotional, gentle)

I wish I had said it earlier. “Thank you.” “Don’t leave so quickly.” “Stay just a little longer.” But I said nothing. I thought there would always be another day… another road to walk together. I was wrong.



(looks up at the sky)

But even now, even after all these years… I’m still searching. Not for them—no. Their journey is long over. I’m searching for the meaning behind the time we shared. For the reason their short lives touched mine so deeply.



(light smile)

Maybe that’s what it means to live among humans. To learn, little by little, how precious each fleeting 
nt truly is. And to carry those 
nts with you, no matter how far you travel… or how long you remain.



(whispers)

I’m still walking, you know. And I hope… wherever you are… you’re watching the path ahead of me.

title: PowerPoint / Prezi Pitch Deck Designer (Healthcare App Partner Pitch)
description:
Overview



I’m preparing a high-impact pitch for a healthcare app (early-stage) to bring on partners. I need an experienced PowerPoint and/or Prezi specialist who can help research, shape the story, and design a polished, credible final pitch.



This is not a generic “make it pretty” job. I need someone who understands pitch structure, evidence, and narrative flow, and can turn rough content into a deck that lands with senior stakeholders.



Key Outputs



A final pitch deck in PowerPoint or Prezi (your recommendation based on the story and audience)



A clear storyline with strong structure: problem ? opportunity ? solution ? why now ? traction/validation ? partner ask



Visually consistent design (templates, typography, icons, charts)



Optional: short “talk track” notes per slide and a 1-page executive summary



Responsibilities



Gather and organise inputs (notes, rough slides, product concept, target users, partner types)



Light research to strengthen the pitch (market context, credible stats, competitor positioning, relevant trends)



Create a recommended deck outline and slide-by-slide storyboard



Design the deck with strong visual hierarchy, simple diagrams, and clear messaging



Build clean charts/graphics and “how it works” visuals (user journey, workflow, architecture at a high level)



Iterate quickly based on feedback, keeping version control clean



Ensure the deck feels appropriate for a healthcare context (trust, safety, privacy-aware messaging)



Required Skills



Proven experience designing partner/investor pitch decks



Advanced PowerPoint skills (master slides, layouts, animations/transitions used appropriately) and/or Prezi (zoomable canvas storytelling)



Strong information design: simplifying complexity without dumbing it down



Excellent written English and ability to tighten copy



Ability to work from ambiguous inputs and create clarity



Nice to Have



Experience in healthcare, healthtech, or regulated industries



Ability to create simple product/UI mock screens (or polish existing screenshots/Figma exports)



Experience with data storytelling and sourcing credible references



Engagement Details



Timeline: [e.g., 1–2 weeks] to first full draft, then refinements



Estimated effort: [e.g., 15–30 hours total]



Working style: async + [2] short calls (kick-off + final rehearsal)



Please share your rate (hourly or fixed price) and availability



What to Send When Applying



Portfolio link (must include decks you’ve designed)



1–2 examples of a pitch deck you’ve led end-to-end (story + design)



Which tool you recommend for this pitch (PowerPoint vs Prezi) and why



Your availability over the next two weeks



Paid Trial

Shortlisted candidates may be invited to complete a paid mini-task: propose a deck outline + redesign one slide to confirm fit.

 flows, SEO, and funnel optimization

4+ years of direct e-commerce growth experience (show proof)

Case study or 2-minute Loom video showing e-commerce store(s) you've scaled (revenue results + backend data)

Strong understanding of eCom KPIs: CAC, ROAS, LTV, CTR, CVR

Familiarity with Shopify/WooCommerce, Klaviyo, Meta Ads, Google Ads, and landing page builders

Solid experience driving traffic organically + through paid campaigns

Understanding of upsells, AOV, bundling, and offer strategy



IMPORTANT: Read Before Applying



Sovereign Spirits Inc. operates in the peptide, health optimization, and weight release space, which often overlaps with gray market products. This includes research-use-only compounds, novel ingredients, and niche wellness products not broadly understood or accepted by mainstrea
dia and ad platforms.



As a result, our marketing requires advanced knowledge of compliance-safe copywriting, funnel strategy, platform-specific ad policies, and indirect persuasion tactics. If you're not already familiar with working around restricted ad categories, gray-area supplements, or platform workarounds (e.g., running native,
, SEO, or third-party traffic instead of Meta/Google ads alone), this is NOT the right fit.



We do not promote illegal or unsafe products. But due to public and regulatory misunderstanding of peptides and gray-market wellness compounds, we often face restrictions and ad rejections. Our success depends on clever, strategic, and ethical marketing that respects platform policies while still converting.



Please do not apply unless:



You are comfortable working in non-mainstream wellness spaces



You’ve navigated compliance-heavy industries (CBD, crypto, nootropics, hormone support, biohacking, etc.)



You’re resourceful, creative, and okay with testing stealthy but ethical strategies



You have a solid understanding of conversion psychology and customer journey building outside of standard ad platforms



Monthly Retainer + Performance Bonus Opportunity

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time (Contract-to-Hire)

Responsibilities include editing videos for platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, managing social media posts, answering messages, following and engaging with other accounts, and fostering online community growth. The ideal candidate is organized, tech-savvy, and can take creative direction or mimic specific styles with video editing. Remote position with flexible hours.
